Since the Earth Rage in 2026, 
the world has suffered 
conflict, killing, pillaging 
and death. Could this be the 
end? Perhaps. Perhaps it's 
exactly why we need 
reanimation.
 
I looked upon the corpses on 
a battlefield and thought, 
"Can't we recycle these?" This 
simple, laudable thought led 
me into the world of human 
resurrection. How to go about 
it? Well, how about making 
them better? Making them 
cooler? This arm here, this 
leg there? My curiosity got 
the better of me, perhaps, but
the end result was our TUBERS.

Only those beyond human, 
becoming a veritable demon 
with SPLithium can hope to 
save the world now. Once 
corpses, now evolved beings, 
leading us into a new 
tomorrow.

Our goal is nothing less than 
"a TUBER in every household." 
We will continue to pursue 
the dream of a world in which 
humans and TUBERS standing 
side-by-side is taken for 
granted.

Our debut model of TUBER. At 
202cm, the average for a male 
basketball player, it rivals the 
best soldiers from any nation. 
Tracks heat sources, then uses
talons to attack. Masks
(sold separately) can also be 
used to make it more cuddly. 
Satisfaction guaranteed. 
Higher durability model 
coming soon!

User's Comments

Human types have just been 
crappy toys before, but this is 
a hardcore weapon. It took 
out 80 enemies for me and 
came back alive!
 
American Soldier, 22

Human types have just been 
crappy toys before, but this is 
a hardcore weapon. It took out
80 enemies for me and came
back alive!
 
American Soldier, 22

The definitive flying model, 
modified from the SCRATCH 
TUBER. Can reach 200m with
the jets on its back, then
strikes with its "symbolic" drill.
It can even "eject" hot stakes
of steel. 
Your own personal horror-movie 
maker will defile your foes from 
above before they even know 
what's defiling them.

Great change from a human
type.  I got all choked up the
first time I saw it also use
its drill to dig a grave for a
fallen comrade.
 
French Soldier, 27

Do you want to burn your foes 
or fill 'em full of holes? For the
sadist in everyone! Two 
special ammo YKZ-A assault 
rifles, a flame thrower AND a 
grenade launcher? Near or far, 
something's getting roasted! 
All weapons are detachable, 
so you can wash away the blood
and grime. Keep it clean,
please!

I love her design. Good company 
when I'm feeling lonely, too.

English Soldier, 32 (single)

This design has won serious 
awards. The fastest and most 
popular TUBER, it can clock 
240km an hour. Just turn it on 
and let it rip - right into your 
enemies! So acrobatic! Truly 
the prima donna of the 
battlefield! Slim and with 
folding rib-like weapons, it 
also takes up almost no 
space when stored.

I just love the design. Nothing to 
fear with one of these on your 
side! I even use it to collect 
money from under vending 
machines!
 
German Soldier, 23

Here it is! The transport TUBER! 
Supplies or documents WILL get 
where you need them! Looks 
like it's riding a unicycle, which 
can cause even the enemy to 
crack a smile. Then it engages 
Bombing Mode. First to smile, 
first to die! A powerful 
self-destruction option also
helps keep your secrets safe.

Odd, definitely, but vital for 
supplying the front line.
My daughter begged me to get
one for home, too. 
Best decision ever.
 
Italian Soldier, 29

Our close-combat model, and our 
largest TUBER. The "stiflers" on 
its arms can exert 2 tons of 
pressure. This haymaker can 
make hay all day! Not to mention
defenses that are off the charts. 
The exposed preset memory on 
the rear must be handled with
care, but it will never turn its 
back on any foe.

Costs close to 10 times as much 
as any other TUBER, but totally 
worth it. Enemies just run away. 
I'd run away if I were them, too.
 
Russian Soldier, 37

Guess what! You can continue for FREE once a day!
Can't hurt to use it, am I right?

Guess what!
You can continue for FREE
#0 times a day! (#1 left.)

Looks like things are about
to get busy around here.

Looks like things are about
to get busy around here.

Looks like things are about
to get busy around here.

Looks like things are about
to get busy around here.
Senpai! I was waiting for you!

This is your first time
riding Line 15, huh?

I know, it's not a very
well known line, I admit.
Anyway, this is the last stop.

It's called an Underworld Rolodex,
and it's super important.

I forgot to mention...
My name is Uncle Death.

I have a feeling we're going
to get along just fine.

Oh, wait, let me put the
title logo up real quick.
You know how these things go.
You seemed sleepy so I turned it off.

I'm talking about the DEATH DRIVE 128
of course, man!
You were just playing it, remember?

Hey, pretty cool, huh?
Pretty badass?

It's the best game console ever!
And this game, LET IT DIE!

It's probably the greatest
game ever made!
The goal of the game is pretty simple.

Just make it to the top
of the Tower of Barbs.

It's like a hack-and-slash
roguelike kind of a thing.

Hey dude!
You're a gamer aren't you?
I'll set it up for you.
I love the smell of new gaming hardware.

This is the long-awaited launch
title for the DEATH DRIVE XXX.

LET IT DIE -- Battle to the Top,
by Liquid Software! Yeah!
I've loaded in your previous progress data.
I'll be here cheering you on.

If you need something,
just drop me a text!

Ah! Those are the Jackals.
They are body collectors.
I wouldn't get in their way if I were you.

I know I know, they got cool looking equipment,
but good luck trying to get it off them.

I knew I knew I knew I knew,
something bad was gonna to happen...

That thing there is what
you call a middle boss!

Oh look, a new specimen!
And this time it's a girl! Uh, I think...

Senpai... I think we have another
mini boss on our hands.

And uh...
This one doesn't even look human.
Tower of Barbs is my home.
And it's where I and my chainsaw roam.

Nice work. Keep it up, and you'll
be at the top in no time.

Let me snap a photo to commemorate
your very first large stamp!

Woohoo! You've finally made it
to the surface, Senpai.

Keep on going.
You're almost at the top now.

Senpai! It's a bomb! If you pick up that head,
you'll be blown to bits!
You're going to have to disarm it!
I knew it was you, Johnny!

Well! You've managed to make it through
your second real challenge. Impressive.

Let me snap a photo to commemorate
your second large stamp!

Try to avoid that wizard's
flame and lightning attacks!

Soon we will discover just how legendary
of a warrior you really are.

Okay, okay. Youve made it this far...
It won't be much longer now. Hehehe.

Let me snap a photo to commemorate
your third large stamp!

Senpai, you've come a long way.
If you fell from here, it'd be certain death.
I had no idea you'd make it this far

Are you some kind of a pro gamer?
Much respect. Word up, buddy!
You are coming up on your final challenge.

Apparently, you cannot equip
anything from this point forward.

I'll hold on to your items for
you in the meantime.

Go on, don't be shy. Ah, come on.
Take off your equipment.
Ready to take off your equipment now?

Don't worry, I'll give everything back later.
Good luck in your fight!

This is a fight to the death!
Winner takes all!

Wow! Sorry, Senpai!
All your equipment got stolen!

Wow! Sorry, Senpai!
All your equipment got stolen!

Wow! Sorry, Senpai!
All your equipment got stolen!

If you can survive, you should be able
to get it all back. Good luck!
We meet at last for the final fight.

N...N...NO WAY! 
You've gotta be kidding me!
I never thought you'd make it this far, dude!

Let me snap a photo to commemorate
your fourth large stamp!
I guess you know the whole story now.
My goal is to destroy all of humankind.
My job is to bring humans to their demise.

Humans do nothing but corrupt
and destroy the Earth.

Even with the lands split into four
pieces they cannot control

their greed and continue to fight
and kill each other.

The time has come for them to pay for their
sins by the hand of Hell's greatest punishment.

The time has come for them to pay for their
sins by the hand of Hell's greatest punishment.
Well, that was the plan anyway.

But you know what?
I'm done with all this.

Senpai, the thing is...
I've really come to respect you!

It's a miracle that you've managed
to make it this far!
Plus, the way you fought to get here...

You're a world class fighter!
You can do anything!

I really just want to see more
of your amazing performance!

So this is supposed to be where
the last boss fight starts,
but I'm done with all that now.

It's the "DEATH DRIVE XXX"!
Have you heard about it?
Come on, come on, let's play!

Of course, you did die after all.
I think dying is pretty awesome though!

Of course, you did die after all.
I think dying is pretty awesome though!

I am in charge of insurance
sales in the Tower of Barbs.

My name is Kiwako Seto and
I work for Direct Hell Insurance.

Many people die in this tower in countless 
numbers of cruel and unusual ways,

and we at Direct Hell Insurance are here
to support those on the brink of death.

Now, allow me to explain our
insurance plan for you.

BUT WAIT! Because this is
your first time, THERE'S MORE!

BUT WAIT! Because this is
your first time, THERE'S MORE!

We're offering you an amazing insurance 
package completely free!

Now then, let's bring you back to life,
shall we?

Strong decision-making is key
to survival in these parts.

Your decision today will surely 
lead to a bright future for you.

Now then, let's bring you back to life,
shall we?

Now then, let's bring you back to life,
shall we?

Your death was totally gruesom-amazing
this time, too!

So what do you think about
our insurance offer now?

So what do you think about
our insurance offer now?

This time your, your death was,
well... gore-tastical!

So what do you think about 
our insurance offer now?

So what do you think about
our insurance offer now?
Oh, I see. That's too bad.

Sometimes such decisions are
necessary though, I understand.
Unfortunately, you've run out of time.

If you don't act now, you will
surely die in the explosion.
To save yourself from this gruesome fate,

we're prepared to offer you our
newest service, timer insurance!

Would you like to take advantage of
our convenient timer insurance?

Thank you! I believe you have
made a very smart decision.
I will reset the timer now.

Now then,
prepare yourself for the explosion.

Dear Senpai,

It's me! 
I've decided to mail you
stuff that's difficult to say in
person. Not! Nah, it's not really
difficult, but whatever.

So you been reading that
instruction manual thingy?
I don't read that kind of stuff
myself, but... just thought I'd ask.

You don't have to read it for
every single thing. Just refer
to it when you need to, OK?
It's really useful, has a
Tutorial section and all.

Oh! Have you tried 
collecting stamps yet?
There's a Stamping Station on
every floor. Give it a try!

Stamping the 10th one is tough,
so prepare yourself, huh? All
right, that's all from me!

If you got any problems, check
the Wiki. Ha, just kidding.

Later.

Dear Senpai,
 
It's me!
Listen, Senpai!
I heard you already challenged
the 4 FORCEMEN!
Shoulda known you would!
Always looking for a challenge,
aren'tcha!
That's cool as shit!
 
So about this White Steel thing
Bleh, that's too long.
Can we call it WS?
Anyway! I hear certain shrooms
don't work on it! Yikes.
What a hassle!
 
Oh yeah! Another thing, Senpai.
You prolly want a WS Blueprint,
don'tcha...
Well, rumor has it they only drop
in Hard or Nightmare difficulty.
Hey now, I'm not saying
Normal's a waste of time!
You could use it for practice
or something, right?
Then again, someone with
your mad skills could jump
right into the action with
no problem, huh?
My bad!
 
Anyway, still rooting for you!
Catch you later!

Dear Senpai,

It's me! 
I hope you've had a great
time with LET IT DIE. Hey, I know this is
kinda sudden, but you can now
switch your mounts in
the Stamp Collection.
Now you can start afresh!
There's no need, you're thinking?

Well, if you stamp them all
in neatly, you can get an even
better reward, you see!

I'll be rooting for you!

Dear Senpai,

It's me! Watch out for those
Jackals just now. They're
dispatched by the "Sunflower
Ceremony" company. You've
probably seen already, but they
retrieve corpses, as well as
stealing equipment for the black
market. They cause a lot of
problems for Fighters in the
Tower. Out of control.

Oh! MEIJIN's fought them lots
of times, so you might be able
to learn something from him.

I think Mother Barb in the arcade
has a video on them as
well, so check it out.

Not to be weird or anything, but
you know that girl in their
group? Yeah, to be honest, I
kinda have a thing for her. The
dangerous charm has appeal,
don't you think? Maybe it's the
whole masked beauty thing...
ah, whatever. Sorry 'bout that.

Well then, later!

Dear Senpai,

Sorry to bother you again.
Um, about the flabby mid-boss...
Seems there's more than one.
They're actually mass-produced.
I don't know when or where
you'll encounter them again,
though. Yeah, that's not much help, I know.
 
This is you we're talking
about here, Senpai, so I
know you'll just be fine.
I feel it in my bones!
Looks like there are other
mid-bosses lurking about,
though. A chilling prospect!
 
Catch you later!

Dear Senpai,

It's me again.
By the way, about that rotting
shooter girl thing you dispatched
so brilliantly just a while ago...

I guess you've figured out what
I'm gonna say. Yep, there's more
than one of 'em, so watch out.

I've got even more good news.
Seems there are two more types
of mid-boss lurking around out
there. What's next? Maybe we'll
get a cutie? No chance, LOL!

Catch you later!

Dear Senpai,

You guessed it, me again.
Congrats on defeating your 3rd
mid-boss! This one was the
weirdest yet, huh? Of course,
you'll see it again.

Oh yeah, can you do a bridge, Senpai? 
I tried to copy that mid-boss,
but I think I did something to my
bones. Ha ha. Heard a big "crack"
sound, actually. Thought you'd
find it funny. Got kinda off-topic
there, huh?

Yeah, better not try and emulate
it. Or whatever.

Later!

Dear Senpai,

Nice work with that Mid-Boss!
That thing was weird, huh? I
mean, what's with that tail?
Now, according to rumors, that
flabby Mid-Boss and the rotting
girl one got a romance going on,
and somehow a child was born
from the Bridging Mid-Boss. That
child was that tailed Mid-Boss.
Yeah. I have no idea what the
hell that means, either. Ha ha!
Anyway, there are some weird
things in this world.

Anyway, you defeated it, so
kudos, Senpai. I'll keep rootin' for ya!

Dear Senpai,

It's me!
Oh yeah, there are loads of beasts
in the tower, right? The tower's
teeming with gas from those
mushrooms, so every beast has
evolved, developing its own way
of dealing with it. And if you
stomp on them, mushrooms grow
out. Wonder if they got afflicted
by the spores or something...

You can basically restore your HP
when you eat them, so whip off
that mask and chow down.

Beasts you catch will be recorded
in the Beast Encyclopedia, so
give it a check.

There are also especially rare
versions of beasts around, so
keep an eye out.

Have you tried frogs, by the way?
Let me know how they taste, huh?

Well, later!

Dear Senpai,

It's me!
Whew. You got resurrected OK,
huh? Once you die in this game,
it's quite tricky to revive you.
See, we have to ask Miss Seto,
a company agent.

She represents a Continue
Insurance company, and also
runs the Direct Hell Express.
There should be a mail from
her with the details.

She's also got a damn fine
scooter, Miss Seto. Her hobby's
taking photos. You get the idea.

You can use the insurance to
revive, but take care, alright?

Dear Senpai,

It's me.
You got a Blueprint! Nice work!
That's really good news.

If a weapon runs out of
Durability points and breaks,
you can now make another
whenever you want! Give
yourself a pat on the back, huh?

First, take it to Kommodore
Suzuki in the Waiting Room.
He's a capable guy, despite
what you might think: he'll figure
what the blueprint's for and
what's needed to make it for
you right away.
And if you can't make use of the
Blueprint, he'll buy it at a high price!

Well, get him to look at it!
Later!

Dear Senpai,

It's me!
Looks like you've reached the
2nd Floor just fine! Did you
notice the "D.O.D ARMS" fist
mark on the wall? If you didn't,
you will sooner or later.

That mark seems to be related
in some way to this area's Boss.
For the essentials on the Boss,
gather the fallen magazine pages...
At least that's what MEIJIN says.

I think the name of the magazine
is "Tales from the Barbs." 
Just pick up any pages you find!
You probably have already.

Well, later!

Dear Senpai,

Yeah, it's me.
Ahh, it's great to be able to see
the sky, huh? Gives you a real
sense of liberation. Take a nice,
deep breath. Oh, wait. The
atmosphere's kinda toxic, so
on second thought, don't.
Whoops!

The area between the 11th
and 21st floors is called
"Jackson's Area."

While we're at it, mind if I tell
ya about the new marks on the
wall? This one has a Falcon
Crest, with "WAR ENSEMBLE"
written on it. Ominous, huh?

By the way, up to this point
there have been lots of enemies
with "D.O.D ARMS" equipment,
right? Well, in this area, you'll
see more carrying "WAR ENSEMBLE"
equipment.

If you see any more magazine
pages around, you know what to do!

Well, later!

Dear Senpai,

It's me! I know there's this rule
I'm supposed to say something
relevant whenever you reach a 
new area, but hey, it's my own
rule. See, I got into this convo
with MEIJIN and stuff... Look,
it's not like I forgot ya or
anything, Senpai! Anyway, my bad.

So, ahem... Congrats on reaching
the 21st floor! The area between
the 21st and 30th floors is
known as "Crowley's Area."

From now on, I'll be watching you
more closely, Senpai. Well, I
mean, I'll be watching over you.

Have you got into KAMATEK yet?
I've seen the next wall mark!
"CANDLE WOLF," huh? Wonder
what that means.

KAMATEK used to be a giant
amusement park, and the
mascot's name was Kamatekon
or Kamachochan or something.

Well, later!

Dear Senpai,

Uh-huh, it's me again.
Sorry to bother you!
This place is like a group
of high-rise buildings, huh?
Yeah, it's another strange one.

The area between the 31st and
40th floors is known as
"Gunkanyama's Area."

I've spotted another of those
Wall Marks. This one has
"M.I.L.K" written on it! Yeah,
there's no mistaking it. I
went and checked to be sure.
Don't underestimate it, though,
looks kinda macho.

Also... there's apparently this
new Mid-Boss MEIJIN was talking
about. He was muttering about
how it never used to be there
and some stuff I didn't really get.

Anyway, you know I'm backing
you, man. Later!

Dear Senpai,
 
You guessed it, me again.
The former-Senpai you just
defeated has been recovered and
is now chilling in the Fighter
Freezer. Take them for a spin
whenever you like!

While I've got your attention,
let me tell you about different
types of enemies.

* Fighters
This is what we call the guys &
gals you control, Senpai.

* Haters
Fighters turn into Haters if they
die in the Tower. Just like that
former-Senpai-turned-corpse you
just encountered! If you see an
orange-colored name, watch out.

* Screamers
Grunts, you'd probably call them.
Fodder. I guess you've already
squished a fair number of these,
Senpai. They look all moldy,
like zombies, and they're even
dumber than Haters! Bless 'em!

* TUBERS
These freako-freaks ain't Haters
and they ain't Screamers either.

Dear Senpai,
 
It's me.
There's a lot going on in this update,
so let me elucidate!
 
First!
 
"It's a lot easier to attack on TDM!"
 
It seems attacking is now free.
What's more, you don't lose anything
for failing an attack.
So what're you waiting for?
 
Second!
 
"An ironclad defense with defense alarms!"
 
Another feature has been added to make
TDM more tactical! Attaching a
"defense alarm" to a defense fighter makes
them far more effective. Basically,
the alarm summons reinforcements.
 
You can select them from the Metro Front
in "Waiting Room"  "Purchase Alarm"
 
And third!
 
"A lost and found treasure trove?!"
 
Successful attack or defense can now
earn you Lost Bags! Worried
the original owners will come back?
Don't worry, the statutory period's
passed on all items!
 
Next, number four!
 
"Attack Insurance! Safety Guaranteed"
 
Let's say your waiting room gets attacked,
and you're cleared out of your Kill Coins.
As long as you have an express pass,
you'll be able to get back all the stolen
Kill Coins and SPLithium! Isn't that cool?
 
Nearly there, number five!
 
"Customize your waiting room!"
 
Now you can spend as much time and
effort as you want on making your room
just the way you want it!
 
Check it out at Metro Front 
Waiting Room  Redecorate
 
The last one! Number six!
 
"Recycling! Good for the earth AND for you!"
 
You've found yourself with duplicate
blueprints or premium decals, am I right?
Well I have some good news for you!
You can now take all your unwanted
blueprints and premium decals to the
Hernia Vending Machine and turn them
into Recycle Points! Save up the points
and exchange them for items!
 
You can pick either Recycle Blueprints
or Recycle Decals from the
Hernia Vending Machine.
 
...Sorry for the long message.
 
Oh, and the following Barb's Bibles
and TDM Bibles have been updated.
 
 Barb's Bible Vol.13 "Hernia Vending Machine"
 Barb's Bible Vol.20 "Direct Hell Services"
 
 TDM Bible Vol.1 "Tokyo Death Metro"
 TDM Bible Vol.2 "Attacks"
 TDM Bible Vol.5 "Defense"

The story goes that when
the child prodigy Crowley
was born in a village in 
Sweden, he emerged from
the womb chanting the
digits of Pi like an 
incantation.

At 17 he entered university,
eventually gaining a PhD. 
A leader in the field of 
plasma physics, it was said
his work would one day be
paradigm shifting.

He also became famous for
his game "Thunder
Revolution," which features
a wizard, which he made with
the tabletop RPG group
"Candle Wolf."

But things were not as they
seemed. Despite his youth,
Crowley's skin became
wrinkled. His friends just
dismissed it as too much
studying.

Then, one day, Crowley
vanished. His family
searched for him frantically,
but as the weeks went by
there was no sign of him.

Just as the missing person
posters began to fade,
disaster struck the town. 
Bolts of lightning exploded
out of a clear blue sky,
quite literally "a bolt out
of the blue."

The lightning bolts burned
the town to cinders, killing
more than 200 people. The
government assembled an
expert response team, but
they drew no conclusion
except that it was a freak 
natural occurrence. 

The people lived in fear of
the next strike. At the same
time that the lightning hit,
Crowley reappeared in town.
 
No one believed it was him. 
He now entirely resembled
the aged wizard from the
game he had so proudly
created.

Crowley explained that he'd
performed plastic surgery
on himself so that he'd 
resemble the wizard, and
that the "bolts from the
blue" were his own
handiwork. 

The police laughed at first,
but their smiles vanished
when they set foot inside
Crowley's hideout.

There they found the
beautiful yet repulsive
plasma weapon that
Crowley had created, a
game card depicting the
aged wizard Crowley had
become, and his surgical
instruments.

The lightning strike was the
fallout of his desire to be a
wizard. 

Crowley confessed
everything, but just then
the Earth Rage global
tectonic shift hit, and a
mysterious lightning bolt
struck him dead. The
"Thunder Revolution" cards
were thrown into the air, and
as they dropped to the floor,
Crowley's head mysteriously
vanished from his shoulders.

He was dead at age 17. His
wizened old head, the
ultimate in RPG cosplay,
has never been found.

Born in Japan, Taro
Gunkanyama excelled at
every sport. Speed skating
was his only weak point.
Although of small build, he
was a natural athlete.

After graduating, he
announced he was going to
be a sumo wrestler, despite
not meeting the minimum
height requirements.
 
He did, however, manage to
pass the medical
examination tests by
hiding a model battleship
inside his coiffure, 
earning him the wrestling
name "Gunkanyama"
(Mt. Battleship).

Gunkanyama excelled at
sumo and his fans hoped
that he'd topple the
foreign-born wrestlers who
dominated the rankings.

However, something
strange was occurring in
the athletics world. A total
of 18 wrestlers and athletes
of large build went missing. 

With no leads, the daily
tabloids were splashed with
lurid rumors ranging from
"Alien Abduction?" to 
"National Intrigue!" 

TV shows even had
psychics try to divine their 
whereabouts, all to no avail.

Something was also afoot at
the sumo stable. Their
suppliers changed, and meat
that didn't seem like beef,
pork, or chicken began to
appear in their chanko
stew. 

Although some did dare to
eat the mystery meat, it
tasted so strange they'd spit
it out, but Gunkanyama
gobbled it up as if he knew
exactly what kind of meat it
was.

He grew rapidly to be 7' 10"
tall, and rose through the
sumo rankings to the very
top. The Gunkanyama Era
had dawned.

No sooner had he won a
grand slam than
Gunkanyama announced
his retirement from sumo.

Although sad to say
goodbye to the sumo world,
Gunkanyama soon founded
the Muscle International
League Killers (M.I.L.K.), a
squad of athletes skilled in 
hand-to-hand combat. 

They modded rackets, bats,
javelins, archers' bows and
other sports apparatus,
turning them into weapons,
creating a mixed-martial art
that was almost baroque in
its cut-throat violence.

The M.I.L.K. games struck a
chord, even topping the
ratings of all the New Year's 
Eve shows. However, the
bouts were so extreme that
many contenders were
killed, even during practices. 
Dark rumors again began to 
swirl.

Gunkanyama convened a
meeting, but was interrupted
by the Earth Rage global 
tectonic shift.

A speed-skating boot came
flying, striking and
decapitating Gunkanyama.
He was dead at 28. The
whereabouts of his head
are still unknown.

Colonel Jackson was born in
Los Angeles. As a kid, he
was fascinated by action
movies with muscle-bound
heroes, and got hooked on
weight training. 

Jackson became a soldier in
the US-led Allied Forces,
advanced to the rank of
Colonel, joined the "War 
Ensemble," and developed
weapons. 

He was also a narcissist,
using anything reflective,
even a weapon, to check
himself out, and was often
spotted naked and admiring
his well-toned physique.

Jackson was particularly
skilled at making bombs,
and became known as the
"Happy Bomber." 

When testing his bombs,
he loved to feel the blast
against his skin, like a soft
caress, often doing these
tests in the nude.

He soon became addicted
to the thrill and acquired
a bad habit of taking selfies
in front of the explosions.
 
He shared the photos on
social networks, and
engineered increasingly
hazardous photo-ops to get
more "likes." Until...

Jackson was never
really into girls, and his
friends used to give him
shit for it. Then, one day
he met someone who
showed him affection for
the first time. 

That man was Johnny, his
army subordinate and love
of his life. They met while
watching the international
hit movie "Chuck Morris
vs. Breadator 4" on
opening day. He
remembered wearing out
the video tapes starring
these heroes of his
childhood, and Johnny was
in the seat next to him
in the theater. After
learning that they were
assigned to the same
squad, he felt the pull of
destiny. 

They went out to eat
together afterwards and
hit it off immediately. 

They promised to be
together forever, and
though they tried, they
were eventually
separated by the same
fate that had brought them 
together. Jackson finally
paid the price for his bad
habit...

The War Ensemble's new
cluster bomb was about
to be tested.

True to form, right at the
edge of the safety zone,
Jackson was readying to
take a selfie. Wanting to
take a photo to mark their 
engagement, Jackson had
dragged Johnny along.

However, the bomb turned
out to be a lot more
powerful than expected,
and they were blown away. 
Sitting up in a cloud of dust, 
Jackson called out, but no 
answer came.
 
Half of Johnny's body was 
missing.

Jackson became deranged
with grief.

He resigned the army and
returned to LA, but all he
could do was continuously
cry out "Johnny..."

One day, he went into town
clutching his selfie stick,
and indiscriminately threw
43 hand grenades. 

But as he was being
arrested, the Earth Rage
global tectonic shift hit.

The explosion from a flying
grenade cleaved Jackson's
head off his shoulders. He
was dead at age 32. Only
his beautifully toned torso
remained.

Max Sharp, born in Nashville, 
was the only son of the
owner of the store "D.I.Y. 
OR DIE." 

Always playing with
dad's tools, he was a D.I.Y. 
prodigy by the age of 3. 

Inspired by a TV show 
depicting body modification, 
Max modded his own body. 
He grafted his arms onto his
head to make precision
engineering easier. Now he
could fashion screws 0.1mm
thin. 

Unlike the other children, he
would spend recess
counting the number of
threads on his screws.

Max's odd appearance made
him a target for ridicule. 

One day, a classmate called
him "crab man," and an
enraged Max crucified him
against the school wall. 
Thereafter, "crab man"
became a taboo word. 

By using these terror
tactics, Max had, by the
age of 15, accrued a
gang of more than 50,
armed with modded
hammers, drills, and
chainsaws from the store.

Whenever they smashed a
rival gang, he'd hammer a
nail into his jaw as a kind
of trophy.

Max led a dual existence. By
day he was the owner of a
D.I.Y. store, but by night he
was the merchant of death
selling "D.O.D. ARMS"-brand
modded weapons to all and
sundry. There wasn't a
single soul in the
underworld who didn't know
his name. 

Max would've gone on
making a killing like this,
until a brawl in a bar
changed his life forever.

One evening, at his usual
bar, some youths picked a
fight with him. At first he
ignored them, but then...

One of the punks yelled at
Max, "what are you staring
at, crab man!" Everyone in
the bar fell silent, waiting to
see whether the taboo word
would be Max's cue to vent
his rage.

Max pulled an electric
screwdriver out of his bag,
and was about to crucify
the punk against the wall
when the bar owner
intervened, and the youths
fled the bar at full pelt. 

And yet the punk's words 
gnawed away at Max, and
his rage, rather than abating,
took deeper root.

Max, his body bristling with
every power tool, went to
each punk's house and 
massacred their families.
He used his power tools to
mod the corpses into
pieces of furniture. 

Having murdered 23 people
as only a true do-it-
yourselfer could, Max was
arrested. But just then, the
Earth Rage global tectonic
shift hit, and from out of
nowhere a flying saw 
decapitated him. 

At age 45, he was dead. At
his funeral, his torso was
buried without the head.

When you fight with a projectile weapon,
reload lots or you'll get slowed down by
enemies. Use #BTNS_R2 while holding #BTNS_AA for
weapons on your right hand, and for ones on
your left use #BTNS_L2 while holding #BTNS_AA.
For double handed weapons, use either.
I always whisper "Loaded!"when I'm done.

It's a pretty basic tech, but you can 
run up to a downed enemy 'n' whack 'em
with #BTNS_AA. I guess you figured that from
the Icon, huh? You can hit 'em twice
before they get up, so give 'em hell. 
Like, no need for mercy, it's a game.

If you're blown back by an enemy you 
can recover. Haven't I told you? My bad,
man. You gotta press #BTNS_BB with the right
timing just as your character hits the
floor flat. Get it right, and you'll snap
out of your downed state.

Dash for a set time, and you'll see an
icon: that's your chance! You can throw
out a Drop Kick with #BTNS_AA. I always pull it
out when I see enemies. Whenever I let
'em have it I'm all "Yo, have a niiiice 
day man!" inside. It's like my greeting.

You can actually block damage with
the weapon you've got equipped, or even
with your bare hands.
Just guard with good timing and
the enemy will even stagger back,
giving you a chance to counter. You'll 
look pretty dumb if you mess up, though.

Hey, did you know that you can lock on with
the #BTNS_R3 button? Some people like to use
it, some don't. I always use it when I've got
a ranged weapon to aim. But if you're
surrounded, switch it off! Gotta be
adaptable. If there's nothing to lock onto
then #BTNS_R3 just resets the camera. Try it out!

If you can sneak up to an enemy in
Crouch Mode, it's your chance for a
surprise attack, so press #BTNS_AA to
get 'em with a backdrop.

What music do you like, man? Black metal
and stuff? Check out the radio next to
Naomi, I'm sure it'll have something 
you'll like. It'll play, like, the whole time,
though, so set it to OFF if you're not
feeling it.

If you spot any vending machines that
still have power, you can break 'em by
whacking 'em with #BTNS_AA. You may get
Kill Coins... or an enemy! There's
actually a rumor the vending machine in
this arcade makes weird noises at night.
Did I freak you out?

If you see any large wooden boxes in
the tower, smash 'em, man. Kill Coins 
and beasts come out from inside 'em.
You can even get coins from bricks!
Just be on your guard: sometimes 
enemies are lying in wait behind,
which can kinda suck.

Are you keeping up your beast intake, man?
Fighters get hungry too. Your stamina goes
down faster when you're famished, but when
you're full, guess what? Your HP automatically 
regenerates! When you hear the rumble, that's
your sign. Eat up!

The scenery may change every time you enter the
tower but man, the floors can be complicated, too.
I mean, sometimes there are no elevators, dead
ends and stuff, you know? Think you're stuck?
Press the down button to check your map!
Maybe there's a sneaky area hiding away that you
haven't visited yet... So, let the scouring begin!

Whenever you're at a certain height with
an enemy below you and you see an
icon, hit #BTNS_AA. In some places you can
perform a Frankensteiner! If the enemy's
aware of you, though, you won't get the
icon, so bonus points if you pull it off, man.

Heard of the "Gyaku-Funsha"? It's the
sister-store of the Choku-Funsha here, 
and it's got some pretty neat stuff.
It moves around, though, so you
never know where it's gonna be next.
And if youre REALLY lucky,
you may get a Kill Coin bonus!

Did you know you can taunt by pressing
the #BTNS_L1 and #BTNS_R1 at the same time?
They vary with the fighter, so try 'em
out! If I get a chance during a fight, 
it's all about the taunt. Plus, when you
pull it off, you'll please the audience.

The vending machine here sells "Solo 
Shelters," for when you wanna quit 
midway through and stuff. At my level,
you wanna use the HP regen feature as
much as possible: Quit, restart, and bingo!
Full HP. Not that I ever stop halfway through.

There's no need to buy one immediately,
but when you need materials, Collector 
types are the deal. Wander around the
tower searching for the stuff you need 
and when you're about to die, make a
break for the elevator! Pretty fun way to play.

The mid-boss COEN is blind, relies on 
sound to attack, so if you don't make
noise, it wont know where you are!
With Crouch Mode, it's pretty easy to 
beat it. Just watch out for its howl,
as it'll locate you from the echo:
crouch and run!

In the fight with JIN-DIE, you wanna be
dashing and dodging the bullets!
Dont miss the chance after it fires a
powerful shot, and counterattack at
point-blank range! It's better to use a close
range weapon over projectile weapons here.

GOTO-9 has some nasty attacks, with its
slippery vomit and stuff. Its body press
is especially painful. Run and jump to
evade it, and don't get close when its
aura emerges. How to attack? Well, it 
likes mushrooms, so try throwing some!

U-10's tail attack is super-annoying,
huh? When its flying in midair you
can't hit it, no matter what you do, so
aim for it when it comes down. You only
have a small window for the counterattack,
so choose a weapon that packs a punch.

The electric fence is the key to the 
fight with Max. Of course, you have to
be careful you don't get forced into
it, but the player isnt the only one
who can be shocked. If you can force him
into it, the outcome is in your hands!

When defusing the bombs in the Jackson
fight, avoid unnecessary fighting. The
danger is the rockets he launches at
you. Use close-range attacks, as he 
won't send out the rockets as often. Oh!
And when you dodge, watch the mines, man.

When Crowley prepares to fire, you better
run for it. Watch out for the lightning attack
he uses, too. When he finishes, that's your
chance to counterattack! It's like texting girls,
man... Gotta know when to push and when to
retreat.

It seems like Gunkanyama reads where
you're going, so if you see him about to
fire, dash in the direction opposite to
the one you're heading in. He'll also
use attacks that restrict your movement,
so rotate the left stick to break out!

I can't say too much about this, but if
you stay on the same floor long
enough, the Jackals will appear. You
might be tempted to take them on, but
I'm telling you, you see them coming,
you run, man. Trust me on this one.

You ran into the Jackals? Well, if you
defeat them, they're sure to drop
something. They have weapons, armor,
and  totally unique items that are on 
whole other level! It'll take a lot of
effort and prep, but if you win, you might
just become like me.

Haters with Orange names are smarter and
faster than Screamers. They can be
manipulated, though. Since Haters will
attack anyone, bringing a Screamer and
Hater together will let you profit from
their fight. Provided there's a Screamer...

The weird-headed guys in the tower?
Scratch Tubers. If they raise both
hands, watch out, or it's gonna hurt.
I've never been hit by that, mind. 
There's 5 different colors for each
tuber type. If you see one different
from normal, take care!

Those flying dudes are Hovering Tubers.
Stay back? They'll use their long-distance
attack. Get close? They'll make use of the
drill. Their thrusting attack from the air is
dangerous but if you evade it, you'll get a
counterattack chance.

The ones with guns strapped to their
waists are Bullet Tubers. They're real
trigger-happy, and like to test their
flamethrowers if you get close. That
said, a frontal attack's the way to go!
Evade their bullets and use a
close-range weapon.

Those tricky dudes are Bone Tubers,
the fastest of the bunch. They seem
tough at first, but the trick is to
knock 'em down. Since they take ages to
get back up on those spindly legs 
of theirs, you've got the perfect
counterattack chance!

The ones with giant bodies are Reversal
Tubers. The worst thing about them is
that you can't damage them from the front.
Get round the back and hit 'em with a
close-range move, then be ready to dodge
their turnaround attack. You got this.

The dudes on monocycles are Treasure
Tubers. Unlike the others, these weirdos
try to flee when they see you. I always
chase 'em. If they take damage and collapse,
they'll try to self-destruct, so if you see it
coming, hurry and trample 'em!

There are many weapons, but when it
comes down to it, your natural ones are
the most reliable! Your fists aren't as
powerful and the reach is less, but if you
up your Mastery Level, you can use a
powerful move. Plus, they'll never leave you.

You found a Machete weapon? Nice one, 
those things are easy to use. Good reach,
decent power... and the 3-hit combo is
easy to time. Up your Mastery Level and
you can increase the combos and learn
a flying attack! Overpowered, really.

Knife weapons? Great if you can get up
close and personal for some cutting
action. Up your Mastery Level and you can
learn a neat little weaving move, as
well as a follow-up stab to use on
downed foes. They won't know what hit 'em.

A flamethrower weapon, huh? Except for
their Rage Move, these things can't
actually stop the enemy's movement.
Meaning you need a good sense of
distance... kinda like with girls. The
range increases if you up your
Mastery Level, though!

You got a Magnum weapon? These long
range weapons are good for knocking
enemies back, and you can combo the
enemy with up to 6 successive shots.
Does it stop there? Not if you use a 
Rage Move for the lucky 7th shot!

A Stun Rod weapon. So, where does the
name come from? Normal attacks don't
stun enemies, and the Rage Move is
overkill. Wait until you up the Master
Level, though, and you can charge and
hurl electricity at enemies for that shock
factor!

A Shotgun weapon, you say? Rather than
hitting a compact pack of enemies at
wide-range, this is better for firing
loads of small bullets at point-blank!
And once you up the Mastery Level
you can blow enemies backward!
Nighty-night.

The Sniper Rifle weapon! Admit it, you
always wanted one. Use #BTNS_L2's Scope Mode
to aim at unsuspecting enemies and 
#BTNS_R3 to zoom, carefully target the enemy's
head and... Boom! Upping the Mastery
Level will make your aim smoother.

So you got an Assault Rifle weapon?
Fire it at any range!. It fires in bursts
of 3 at first, but up the Mastery Level
and you get to enjoy Full-Auto mode. I
fire a Rage Move grenade after. Dodge
with #BTNS_BB as it explodes to look cool.

The Shovel weapon, huh? As you know,
this isn't your regular shovel. This
thing can clean up enemies quick. It's
not super maneuverable, but man is it
powerful. Up the Mastery Level, and you
can turn and swing it, charging an intense
attack.

You got yourself a Rocket Launcher? All that
firepower! That crazy range and reach! One shot and
you'll feel like you're in an action flick! Plus, you can
control the trajectory of its Rage Move! That's
telekinesis, Kyle! Raise its Mastery Level and you'll
unlock a charge attack that lets you fire 4 shots at
once. Just try not to blow yourself up, okay?

The Saw weapon? Not gonna lie, it's
pretty violent. The Rage Move, though?
You can fire the blade at the enemy,
making them freeze! Follow up
with an attack. The swinging move
you get from upping the Mastery
Level is good for finishes.

You found a Hammer weapon? 
Smack enemies down like nails, and
when you up the Mastery Level, the
last strike will be even stronger, and
you can use a super fast horizontal
swing. The Rage Move? Reminds me
of when you bang your shin. Ouch.

A Pickaxe Weapon? You wield this
double-handed. Use #BTNS_R2 for vertical and
#BTNS_L2 for horizontal strokes. See an enemy
opening, and use the Rage Move to stab
and toss them behind you. Up your Master
Level and you can follow up with a charge attack!

So you have a Nail Gun? It has a lot of
force with regular attacks, but upping
the Mastery Level will increase the
firing speed like crazy. It can't stop
enemies, but with the Rage Move
you can cover a 180 radius, making
it great for defense.
Hit the Nail on the Head

You found a Welding Gun weapon? You
gotta judge the time between readying
and firing if you want to hit enemies. 
I stop 'em first with a Rage Move then
attack normally. Up the Mastery Level and
the time it takes to fire will be shortened!

You got a Drill Weapon, huh? You
basically attack by walking around with
it on, but be careful or it'll overheat!
It's just the perfect rotating beast to
put the spin on a downed enemy.
You can also increase the Mastery Level
to get access to a tasty piercing attack!

You got an Iron Weapon? The Rage Move
conveniently stops enemies' movement,
so use that chance to get in multiple
steam hits. I love this thing, and I'm sure
you'll grow to. I mean, the  Goretastic
Attack is just like ironing your shirts!

You got a Chopper Weapon? It's a little
unwieldy but its 2-attack combo is 
simple to master. Up the Mastery Level
and you'll get a vertical attack as well,
good for delivering a finishing blow.
Wonder how many enemies I've got
with this...

You have a Firework Weapon? Well, its
attacks are bright and all, but it sure
has a dark side. At first, it just
shoots out fireworks, but up the Mastery
Level and it'll fire orbs that stick to
enemies and... you guessed it. Explode.

You got a Chainsaw? It may seem like a
long weapon, but its reach isn't, so
you'll need to practice attacking at
close-range. The Rage Move is definitely
worthy of attention: when this hits an
enemy, press #BTNS_L2 for some combos!

You got an Axe Weapon? It uses up
stamina fast, and leaves you open, but
the attack power makes up for it. Press
#BTNS_R2 to knock enemies back, and #BTNS_L2 for
multiple strokes. The Rage Move is a
wide swinging attack, great for when
you're surrounded.

You got a Crossbow Weapon? This is 
for players with good timing! By
combining the regular arrow attacks,
which fire at set intervals, and the
Rage Move, which fires arrows at high
velocity, you can really take control of
the fight.

You found a Spear Weapon? This is a
close-range weapon, but it has some
surprising reach! With good use of the
horizontal swing and forward thrust,
you'll have no problems in close-range
combat! Try out the Goretastic, too,
for a real spectacle!

So you got your hands on a Katana
weapon? Seems like a pretty normal
weapon, but once you up the Mastery
Level, the combo potential is insane.
I like to Perfect Guard an enemy's move,
then whip out a Rage Move, before
whispering "...It's over."

You got a Sword Weapon? You can
swing it fairly fast and it's easy to
land 3 consecutive hits. The Rage
Move targets the enemy's vitals:
time it to their attack to look cool.

You have a Claw Weapon? These deal
attacks fast. Up the Mastery Level and
your combos will increase, so equip
them to both hands to become a beast! 
The Rage Move pounces on enemies,
so judge the distance well. I keep
my nails cut, of course.

You got a Flail Weapon, huh? A primitive
metal ball that you just kinda swing
around, but it really packs a punch if you
work that wrist right! Even plays an effect
at max velocity. Up your Mastery Level and
you'll be able to swing it while walking,
and pull off lethal downwards swings.

So you got a Flame Staff Weapon? Bet
you feel like a wizard, huh? The Rage
Move sticks the staff into the ground,
creating a pillar of fire, like you're
some kinda... sorcerer. Yeah. Just
don't set yourself alight, man.

So you found a Shuriken Weapon? Throw these
loyal guys right and they attack on the way
back, too. Up your Mastery Level for a
swinging attack, handy for close range
combat. You can also hold the attack button
down to create a tornado. Helps when you're
facing a mob. Just watch for the cooldown.

You got a Lightning Staff Weapon, huh?
Acting like a wizard is cool and all,
but take care or you'll run outta
ammo. Or battery, whatever. Both
the regular attacks and the Rage Move
have a short range. Oh! Try out the
Goretastic Attack. Trust me.

A Bat Weapon? These can deal up to
3 consecutive strikes. If you up the
Mastery Level and time your attack
between the 2nd and 3rd strike, you
can perform a full swing. They don't
have as much reach as a regular
3rd strike, but they look cooler.

You got a Saber weapon? It's more
of a thrusting sword. Up the Mastery
Level and input the 2nd of the 3
combo hits with perfect timing to
use the 2nd attack up to 5 times!
The timing is just after the arm
stretches out on the 2nd attack.

A Pitching Machine Weapon? The rate
of fire at which the balls are pitched
increases gradually. Up the Mastery
Level and you can make use of a
throwing attack! Stronger than the
machine, this one has the power
of a Major Leaguer's pitch!

You say you got a Boxing Glove Weapon?
It may look like a toy, but this thing's
serious. Upping the Mastery Level lets
you throw out a flurry of hits. Plus, its
Rage Move deals out a barrage of heavy
punches. Let your fists fly! Hyayayayayaya!

A Yo-yo Weapon, huh? The blades on
these can mince things up, but you
gotta judge the distance well. If you
up the Mastery Level, you get a
move that lets you dodge while
attacking! As for the Goretastic...
let's just say it's a HEADY move.

So you got a Bowling Ball Weapon, eh?
Vicious! Who would've thought to stick one
on the end of a pole?! Its attacks are slow
like molasses, but it leaves a hell of an
impact! Raise the Mastery Level to unlock
a harsh downward swing! Its Rage Move lets
you launch and detonate the ball. STRIKE!

A Fire Baton Weapon? It looks hot,
and upping the Mastery Level makes
it even hotter. You can deal out a
beautiful dancing 4-hit combo, and
can even make the flame bigger
for a set time. The flame dies out
for a while after, so use it wisely.

The Motorcycle Weapon! It's something
of a joke, really. Takes a while to
attack, but strong. You can also go
on a rampage with the Rage Move
and plow through a mass of enemies.
Reminds me of my delinquent days.
I used a bicycle, though...

A Hockey Stick Weapon? Among the
two-handed ones, this is fast and
easy to handle. Check enemies
with the horizontal swing, and
finish with the vertical. The Rage
Move loses a puck, but you can't
control its movements, so take care.

An Archer's Bow weapon, huh? These things
take patience to master, but the pay-off is
worth it! Before you take your shot, go
invisible with its Rage Move then aim for
the face! It's also handy as a substitute
for Transparungus when you need to make a
quick getaway. Not that I ever run away...

No way! You got the Jackal Sword?
A-are you after my position? Well,
you're getting there. Well done,
anyway. Needless to say, this
is super strong. The Rage Move is
a beam blade attack that extends
covering a wide area in front! Go boast.

You got the Jackal Gun? No way... Trying to
show me up, are you?! Well, to be fair, I
always knew you had it in you. Congrats!
No need to aim this one; it fires automatic
homing bullets! Plus, its Rage Move is a
guided laser beam! Now THIS is a weapon
to write home to Mom about!

You got the Jackal Yo-yo? You really
wanna be my successor, huh?
When I first saw you, I thought,
"This player's something special!"
Nice! Obviously it's strong, but try
the Rage Move on a pack of enemies.
You'll be the last one standing.

You finally got the Reaper's Scythe!
Well done, you really are something
else. Of course, there's a Master
Level for this, as well. Your attack
methods will increase, and the
Rage Move lets you mow down
enemies on a Skateboard. Enough said.

Your teammate's Fighter is being extracted?
Hmm. It's like, the unwritten rule to help
out. Go to the enemy base and BOOM! If you
succeed, you'll receive a lot of rewards!
Remember, there's nothing greater
than friendship!

Players won't stop getting up in your
grill no matter how much you defend?
Maybe you've got yourself a reputation
as an impregnable Waiting Room! Don't forget
to grab all the SPLithium and gear that
those idiots drop when you kill 'em!

How goes your base capturing, man? Remember
those times when only same level or weaker
Fighters were easy to capture? Well, seems
like things have changed! Chances of a
Fighter getting exhausted enough to carry
home are the same, no matter the level!
So get capturing those high-levels!

Huh? A Fighter you were extracting got
released? Ah well, shit happens. It'll
take a whole 4 hours for the extraction to
complete, but, you know, the higher grade
the Fighter is, the more SPLithium you'll be
able to extract! So don't let the more
precious ones escape...

The trick to winning fights with a player? 
Well, the team with the most HATE will
have a full Rage Gauge at the start of
the raid or defense. The stronger the
opponent you're fighting, the more fight
points you'll get. Good luck man!

Your TDM points just aren't going
up fast enough? Well, you might
just need more of a challenge.
Taking on tougher opponents
seems to increase your points faster,
so go on, be a giant killer.

You sent a Hunter after someone?
Hopefully they'll bring back something
good! You know, if you give them gear,
the durability will go down. It might
even break! The nicer the gear, the
more it'll go down, but that's what it's for!

Heard you got a Spiky Crusher! Rock on!
It's not the fastest, but it's got a
long reach and its explosion AoE attacks
are perfect for when the enemy's
got you surrounded!
Plus, its Rage Move is pretty killer...
Did I mention I'm afraid of needles?

Heard you got an Electric Shock Massager!
Man, that's rad! Anyway, that thing's no
good unless you get up close and personal,
feel me? Whittle 'em down for a bit, wait
for the perfect moment, then jump in and
ZAP! Plus, its Goretastic Attack will blow
your mind. Or the enemy's, actually. LOL!

Nice weapon, right? First, raise the
Mastery Level and get all the ammo
types. You might need a little practice
to get your shots to hit! It's all about
keeping a steady rhythm. If this babe
is too fast for you, press #BTNS_L1 or #BTNS_R1 to slow
down the gun barrel's rotation.

Have you bought a Defense Alarm? It might
just save your waiting room, you know?
But watch out, if a Fighter with an Alarm
attached gets captured then the Alarm stops
working! You'll have to set the Alarm on
another Fighter! Try checking the defense
settings whenever you log in.

So you got your hands on the Vajra of
Light. I love using this weapon, and you
will too! Increasing your Mastery Level for
it will allow you to use the move Spiral
Edge. It'll break an enemy's guard, but
kinda slow to use. At combo level 2 it'll
deal damage no matter what!

You got the Head of Medusa? You can throw
it at enemies from afar and then close the
distance. Just try not to blow yourself up!
Bet you're thinking, pretty shitty for a
Rage Move that uses up 3 gauges, right?
Wrong! When you're surrounded it'll drain
enemies' HP within range instantaneously.

Yo, you got the Mortal Bobslayer? Hit 'em,
shoot 'em, or just chill down a slope on
it! Raise its Mastery Level to get some
more projectiles. 3-Way pumps out damage
at close range, and the Bomb's a surefire
knockdown. And man, that Rage Move! But
check it, you can cancel it with #BTNS_L2 or #BTNS_R2.

Got yourself a Lion Dance Knuckle weapon?
This is a true weapon of intricacy! Capable
of a flurry of hits, mastering these will
allow you to perform even more punches
and also drain enemy HP. But what's most
impressive is the majestic music that plays
when you're attacking. Dance you proud leo!

Oh! Picked up a Stun Gun weapon, have we?
Fire some spicy electrodes into the enemy
then smack 'em up with another weapon while
they're temporarily out of it! Reloading
will reset the electrodes, but you'll still
have to wait for it to recharge, bummer.
Shake off incoming electrodes with Dodge!

A Timber weapon? Yes, good, very good. This
sucker's a primitive beat stick, not saying
it doesn't pack a punch though! Master it
and you'll be able to set it ablaze and lob
it places, too! It can be a bitch to get
the fire lit; I heard LUK may help here...
Me? I just love flinging 'em everywhere!
Collect all the MEIJIN TIPS, and party with your friends!
Memorize the MEIJIN TIPS, and you'll have nothing to fear!
If MEIJIN looks over at you, it's your chance to get MEIJIN TIPS!
If you share MEIJIN TIPS with everyone, you're a shaman!
When you've read your MEIJIN TIPS, MEIJIN will mail them to you!
Report friends who are cheating to MEIJIN; he'll trash them for ya!

Yo, Meijin here!

So this is just to remind you about that
"Meijin Tips" thing I mentioned. Come
take a look at 'em any time ya like!

Adios, dude!

Meijin

When you fight with a projectile weapon,
reload lots or you'll get slowed down by
enemies. Use #BTNS_R2 while holding #BTNS_AA for
weapons on your right hand, and for ones on
your left use #BTNS_L2 while holding #BTNS_AA.
For double handed weapons, use either.
I always whisper "Loaded!"when I'm done.

It's a pretty basic tech, but you can 
run up to a downed enemy 'n' whack 'em
with #BTNS_AA. I guess you figured that from
the Icon, huh? You can hit 'em twice
before they get up, so give 'em hell. 
Like, no need for mercy, it's a game.

If you're blown back by an enemy you 
can recover. Haven't I told you? My bad,
man. You gotta press #BTNS_BB with the right
timing just as your character hits the
floor flat. Get it right, and you'll snap
out of your downed state.

Dash for a set time, and you'll see an
icon: that's your chance! You can throw
out a Drop Kick with #BTNS_AA. I always pull it
out when I see enemies. Whenever I let
'em have it I'm all "Yo, have a niiiice 
day man!" inside. It's like my greeting.

You can actually block damage with
the weapon you've got equipped, or even
with your bare hands.
Just guard with good timing and
the enemy will even stagger back,
giving you a chance to counter. You'll 
look pretty dumb if you mess up, though.

When you really want an enemy's weapon,
what are you gonna do? Fight and pray
they'll drop it? Just steal it, man!
Approach an enemy when they're weak and
the Steal icon will appear. Hit #BTNS_A quick
and you'll switch to steal mode.
Give it a go!

Hey, did you know that you can lock on with
the #BTNS_R3 button? Some people like to use
it, some don't. I always use it when I've got
a ranged weapon to aim. But if you're
surrounded, switch it off! Gotta be
adaptable. If there's nothing to lock onto
then #BTNS_R3 just resets the camera. Try it out!

If you can sneak up to an enemy in
Crouch Mode, it's your chance for a
surprise attack, so press #BTNS_AA to
get 'em with a backdrop.

What music do you like, man? Black metal
and stuff? Check out the radio next to
Naomi, I'm sure it'll have something 
you'll like. It'll play, like, the whole time,
though, so set it to OFF if you're not
feeling it.

If you spot any vending machines that
still have power, you can break 'em by
whacking 'em with #BTNS_AA. You may get
Kill Coins... or an enemy! There's
actually a rumor the vending machine in
this arcade makes weird noises at night.
Did I freak you out?

If you see any large wooden boxes in
the tower, smash 'em, man. Kill Coins 
and beasts come out from inside 'em.
You can even get coins from bricks!
Just be on your guard: sometimes 
enemies are lying in wait behind,
which can kinda suck.

Are you keeping up your beast intake, man?
Fighters get hungry too. Your stamina goes
down faster when you're famished, but when
you're full, guess what? Your HP automatically 
regenerates! When you hear the rumble, that's
your sign. Eat up!

The scenery may change every time you enter the
tower but man, the floors can be complicated, too.
I mean, sometimes there are no elevators, dead
ends and stuff, you know? Think you're stuck?
Press the down button to check your map!
Maybe there's a sneaky area hiding away that you
haven't visited yet... So, let the scouring begin!

Whenever you're at a certain height with
an enemy below you and you see an
icon, hit #BTNS_AA. In some places you can
perform a Frankensteiner! If the enemy's
aware of you, though, you won't get the
icon, so bonus points if you pull it off, man.

Heard of the "Gyaku-Funsha"? It's the
sister-store of the Choku-Funsha here, 
and it's got some pretty neat stuff.
It moves around, though, so you
never know where it's gonna be next.
And if youre REALLY lucky,
you may get a Kill Coin bonus!

Did you know you can taunt by pressing
the #BTNS_L1 and #BTNS_R1 at the same time?
They vary with the fighter, so try 'em
out! If I get a chance during a fight, 
it's all about the taunt. Plus, when you
pull it off, you'll please the audience.

The vending machine here sells "Solo 
Shelters," for when you wanna quit 
midway through and stuff. At my level,
you wanna use the HP regen feature as
much as possible: Quit, restart, and bingo!
Full HP. Not that I ever stop halfway through.

There's no need to buy one immediately,
but when you need materials, Collector 
types are the deal. Wander around the
tower searching for the stuff you need 
and when you're about to die, make a
break for the elevator! Pretty fun way to play.

The mid-boss COEN is blind, relies on 
sound to attack, so if you don't make
noise, it wont know where you are!
With Crouch Mode, it's pretty easy to 
beat it. Just watch out for its howl,
as it'll locate you from the echo:
crouch and run!

In the fight with JIN-DIE, you wanna be
dashing and dodging the bullets!
Dont miss the chance after it fires a
powerful shot, and counterattack at
point-blank range! It's better to use a close
range weapon over projectile weapons here.

GOTO-9 has some nasty attacks, with its
slippery vomit and stuff. Its body press
is especially painful. Run and jump to
evade it, and don't get close when its
aura emerges. How to attack? Well, it 
likes mushrooms, so try throwing some!

U-10's tail attack is super-annoying,
huh? When its flying in midair you
can't hit it, no matter what you do, so
aim for it when it comes down. You only
have a small window for the counterattack,
so choose a weapon that packs a punch.

The electric fence is the key to the 
fight with Max. Of course, you have to
be careful you don't get forced into
it, but the player isnt the only one
who can be shocked. If you can force him
into it, the outcome is in your hands!

When defusing the bombs in the Jackson
fight, avoid unnecessary fighting. The
danger is the rockets he launches at
you. Use close-range attacks, as he 
won't send out the rockets as often. Oh!
And when you dodge, watch the mines, man.

When Crowley prepares to fire, you better
run for it. Watch out for the lightning attack
he uses, too. When he finishes, that's your
chance to counterattack! It's like texting girls,
man... Gotta know when to push and when to
retreat.

It seems like Gunkanyama reads where
you're going, so if you see him about to
fire, dash in the direction opposite to
the one you're heading in. He'll also
use attacks that restrict your movement,
so rotate the left stick to break out!

I can't say too much about this, but if
you stay on the same floor long
enough, the Jackals will appear. You
might be tempted to take them on, but
I'm telling you, you see them coming,
you run, man. Trust me on this one.

You ran into the Jackals? Well, if you
defeat them, they're sure to drop
something. They have weapons, armor,
and  totally unique items that are on 
whole other level! It'll take a lot of
effort and prep, but if you win, you might
just become like me.

Haters with Orange names are smarter and
faster than Screamers. They can be
manipulated, though. Since Haters will
attack anyone, bringing a Screamer and
Hater together will let you profit from
their fight. Provided there's a Screamer...

The weird-headed guys in the tower?
Scratch Tubers. If they raise both
hands, watch out, or it's gonna hurt.
I've never been hit by that, mind. 
There's 5 different colors for each
tuber type. If you see one different
from normal, take care!

Those flying dudes are Hovering Tubers.
Stay back? They'll use their long-distance
attack. Get close? They'll make use of the
drill. Their thrusting attack from the air is
dangerous but if you evade it, you'll get a
counterattack chance.

The ones with guns strapped to their
waists are Bullet Tubers. They're real
trigger-happy, and like to test their
flamethrowers if you get close. That
said, a frontal attack's the way to go!
Evade their bullets and use a
close-range weapon.

Those tricky dudes are Bone Tubers,
the fastest of the bunch. They seem
tough at first, but the trick is to
knock 'em down. Since they take ages to
get back up on those spindly legs 
of theirs, you've got the perfect
counterattack chance!

The ones with giant bodies are Reversal
Tubers. The worst thing about them is
that you can't damage them from the front.
Get round the back and hit 'em with a
close-range move, then be ready to dodge
their turnaround attack. You got this.

The dudes on monocycles are Treasure
Tubers. Unlike the others, these weirdos
try to flee when they see you. I always
chase 'em. If they take damage and collapse,
they'll try to self-destruct, so if you see it
coming, hurry and trample 'em!

There are many weapons, but when it
comes down to it, your natural ones are
the most reliable! Your fists aren't as
powerful and the reach is less, but if you
up your Mastery Level, you can use a
powerful move. Plus, they'll never leave you.

You found a Machete weapon? Nice one, 
those things are easy to use. Good reach,
decent power... and the 3-hit combo is
easy to time. Up your Mastery Level and
you can increase the combos and learn
a flying attack! Overpowered, really.

Knife weapons? Great if you can get up
close and personal for some cutting
action. Up your Mastery Level and you can
learn a neat little weaving move, as
well as a follow-up stab to use on
downed foes. They won't know what hit 'em.

A flamethrower weapon, huh? Except for
their Rage Move, these things can't
actually stop the enemy's movement.
Meaning you need a good sense of
distance... kinda like with girls. The
range increases if you up your
Mastery Level, though!

You got a Magnum weapon? These long
range weapons are good for knocking
enemies back, and you can combo the
enemy with up to 6 successive shots.
Does it stop there? Not if you use a 
Rage Move for the lucky 7th shot!

A Stun Rod weapon. So, where does the
name come from? Normal attacks don't
stun enemies, and the Rage Move is
overkill. Wait until you up the Master
Level, though, and you can charge and
hurl electricity at enemies for that shock
factor!

A Shotgun weapon, you say? Rather than
hitting a compact pack of enemies at
wide-range, this is better for firing
loads of small bullets at point-blank!
And once you up the Mastery Level
you can blow enemies backward!
Nighty-night.

The Sniper Rifle weapon! Admit it, you
always wanted one. Use #BTNS_L2's Scope Mode
to aim at unsuspecting enemies and 
#BTNS_R3 to zoom, carefully target the enemy's
head and... Boom! Upping the Mastery
Level will make your aim smoother.

So you got an Assault Rifle weapon?
Fire it at any range!. It fires in bursts
of 3 at first, but up the Mastery Level
and you get to enjoy Full-Auto mode. I
fire a Rage Move grenade after. Dodge
with #BTNS_BB as it explodes to look cool.

The Shovel weapon, huh? As you know,
this isn't your regular shovel. This
thing can clean up enemies quick. It's
not super maneuverable, but man is it
powerful. Up the Mastery Level, and you
can turn and swing it, charging an intense attack.

You got yourself a Rocket Launcher? All that
firepower! That crazy range and reach! One shot and
you'll feel like you're in an action flick! Plus, you can
control the trajectory of its Rage Move! That's
telekinesis, Kyle! Raise its Mastery Level and you'll
unlock a charge attack that lets you fire 4 shots at
once. Just try not to blow yourself up, okay?

The Saw weapon? Not gonna lie, it's
pretty violent. The Rage Move, though?
You can fire the blade at the enemy,
making them freeze! Follow up
with an attack. The swinging move
you get from upping the Mastery
Level is good for finishes.

You found a Hammer weapon? 
Smack enemies down like nails, and
when you up the Mastery Level, the
last strike will be even stronger, and
you can use a super fast horizontal
swing. The Rage Move? Reminds me
of when you bang your shin. Ouch.

A Pickaxe Weapon? You wield this
double-handed. Use #BTNS_R2 for vertical and
#BTNS_L2 for horizontal strokes. See an enemy
opening, and use the Rage Move to stab
and toss them behind you. Up your Master
Level and you can follow up with a charge attack!

So you have a Nail Gun? It has a lot of
force with regular attacks, but upping
the Mastery Level will increase the
firing speed like crazy. It can't stop
enemies, but with the Rage Move
you can cover a 180 radius, making
it great for defense.
Hit the Nail on the Head

You found a Welding Gun weapon? You
gotta judge the time between readying
and firing if you want to hit enemies. 
I stop 'em first with a Rage Move then
attack normally. Up the Mastery Level and
the time it takes to fire will be shortened!

You got a Drill Weapon, huh? You
basically attack by walking around with
it on, but be careful or it'll overheat!
It's just the perfect rotating beast to
put the spin on a downed enemy.
You can also increase the Mastery Level
to get access to a tasty piercing attack!

You got an Iron Weapon? The Rage Move
conveniently stops enemies' movement,
so use that chance to get in multiple
steam hits. I love this thing, and I'm sure
you'll grow to. I mean, the  Goretastic
Attack is just like ironing your shirts!

You got a Chopper Weapon? It's a little
unwieldy but its 2-attack combo is 
simple to master. Up the Mastery Level
and you'll get a vertical attack as well,
good for delivering a finishing blow.
Wonder how many enemies I've got with this...

You have a Firework Weapon? Well, its
attacks are bright and all, but it sure
has a dark side. At first, it just
shoots out fireworks, but up the Mastery
Level and it'll fire orbs that stick to
enemies and... you guessed it. Explode.

You got a Chainsaw? It may seem like a
long weapon, but its reach isn't, so
you'll need to practice attacking at
close-range. The Rage Move is definitely
worthy of attention: when this hits an
enemy, press #BTNS_L2 for some combos!

You got an Axe Weapon? It uses up
stamina fast, and leaves you open, but
the attack power makes up for it. Press
#BTNS_R2 to knock enemies back, and #BTNS_L2 for
multiple strokes. The Rage Move is a
wide swinging attack, great for when
you're surrounded.

You got a Crossbow Weapon? This is 
for players with good timing! By
combining the regular arrow attacks,
which fire at set intervals, and the
Rage Move, which fires arrows at high
velocity, you can really take control of the fight.

You found a Spear Weapon? This is a
close-range weapon, but it has some
surprising reach! With good use of the
horizontal swing and forward thrust,
you'll have no problems in close-range
combat! Try out the Goretastic, too,
for a real spectacle!

So you got your hands on a Katana
weapon? Seems like a pretty normal
weapon, but once you up the Mastery
Level, the combo potential is insane.
I like to Perfect Guard an enemy's move,
then whip out a Rage Move, before
whispering "...It's over."

You got a Sword Weapon? You can
swing it fairly fast and it's easy to
land 3 consecutive hits. The Rage
Move targets the enemy's vitals:
time it to their attack to look cool.

You have a Claw Weapon? These deal
attacks fast. Up the Mastery Level and
your combos will increase, so equip
them to both hands to become a beast! 
The Rage Move pounces on enemies,
so judge the distance well. I keep
my nails cut, of course.

You got a Flail Weapon, huh? A primitive
metal ball that you just kinda swing
around, but it really packs a punch if you
work that wrist right! Even plays an effect
at max velocity. Up your Mastery Level and
you'll be able to swing it while walking,
and pull off lethal downwards swings.

So you got a Flame Staff Weapon? Bet
you feel like a wizard, huh? The Rage
Move sticks the staff into the ground,
creating a pillar of fire, like you're
some kinda... sorcerer. Yeah. Just
don't set yourself alight, man.

So you found a Shuriken Weapon? Throw these
loyal guys right and they attack on the way
back, too. Up your Mastery Level for a
swinging attack, handy for close range
combat. You can also hold the attack button
down to create a tornado. Helps when you're
facing a mob. Just watch for the cooldown.

You got a Lightning Staff Weapon, huh?
Acting like a wizard is cool and all,
but take care or you'll run outta
ammo. Or battery, whatever. Both
the regular attacks and the Rage Move
have a short range. Oh! Try out the
Goretastic Attack. Trust me.

A Bat Weapon? These can deal up to
3 consecutive strikes. If you up the
Mastery Level and time your attack
between the 2nd and 3rd strike, you
can perform a full swing. They don't
have as much reach as a regular
3rd strike, but they look cooler.

You got a Saber weapon? It's more
of a thrusting sword. Up the Mastery
Level and input the 2nd of the 3
combo hits with perfect timing to
use the 2nd attack up to 5 times!
The timing is just after the arm
stretches out on the 2nd attack.

A Pitching Machine Weapon? The rate
of fire at which the balls are pitched
increases gradually. Up the Mastery
Level and you can make use of a
throwing attack! Stronger than the
machine, this one has the power
of a Major Leaguer's pitch!

You say you got a Boxing Glove Weapon?
It may look like a toy, but this thing's
serious. Upping the Mastery Level lets
you throw out a flurry of hits. Plus, its
Rage Move deals out a barrage of heavy
punches. Let your fists fly! Hyayayayayaya!

A Yo-yo Weapon, huh? The blades on
these can mince things up, but you
gotta judge the distance well. If you
up the Mastery Level, you get a
move that lets you dodge while
attacking! As for the Goretastic...
let's just say it's a HEADY move.

So you got a Bowling Ball Weapon, eh?
Vicious! Who would've thought to stick one
on the end of a pole?! Its attacks are slow
like molasses, but it leaves a hell of an
impact! Raise the Mastery Level to unlock
a harsh downward swing! Its Rage Move lets
you launch and detonate the ball. STRIKE!

A Fire Baton Weapon? It looks hot,
and upping the Mastery Level makes
it even hotter. You can deal out a
beautiful dancing 4-hit combo, and
can even make the flame bigger
for a set time. The flame dies out
for a while after, so use it wisely.

The Motorcycle Weapon! It's something
of a joke, really. Takes a while to
attack, but strong. You can also go
on a rampage with the Rage Move
and plow through a mass of enemies.
Reminds me of my delinquent days.
I used a bicycle, though...

A Hockey Stick Weapon? Among the
two-handed ones, this is fast and
easy to handle. Check enemies
with the horizontal swing, and
finish with the vertical. The Rage
Move loses a puck, but you can't
control its movements, so take care.

An Archer's Bow weapon, huh? These things
take patience to master, but the pay-off is
worth it! Before you take your shot, go
invisible with its Rage Move then aim for
the face! It's also handy as a substitute
for Transparungus when you need to make a
quick getaway. Not that I ever run away...

No way! You got the Jackal Sword?
A-are you after my position? Well,
you're getting there. Well done,
anyway. Needless to say, this
is super strong. The Rage Move is
a beam blade attack that extends
covering a wide area in front! Go boast.

You got the Jackal Gun? No way... Trying to
show me up, are you?! Well, to be fair, I
always knew you had it in you. Congrats!
No need to aim this one; it fires automatic
homing bullets! Plus, its Rage Move is a
guided laser beam! Now THIS is a weapon
to write home to Mom about!

You got the Jackal Yo-yo? You really
wanna be my successor, huh?
When I first saw you, I thought,
"This player's something special!"
Nice! Obviously it's strong, but try
the Rage Move on a pack of enemies.
You'll be the last one standing.

You finally got the Reaper's Scythe!
Well done, you really are something
else. Of course, there's a Master
Level for this, as well. Your attack
methods will increase, and the
Rage Move lets you mow down
enemies on a Skateboard. Enough said.

Your teammate's Fighter is being extracted?
Hmm. It's like, the unwritten rule to help
out. Go to the enemy base and BOOM! If you
succeed, you'll receive a lot of rewards!
Remember, there's nothing greater
than friendship!

Players won't stop getting up in your
grill no matter how much you defend?
Maybe you've got yourself a reputation
as an impregnable Waiting Room! Don't forget
to grab all the SPLithium and gear that
those idiots drop when you kill 'em!

How goes your base capturing, man? Remember
those times when only same level or weaker
Fighters were easy to capture? Well, seems
like things have changed! Chances of a
Fighter getting exhausted enough to carry
home are the same, no matter the level!
So get capturing those high-levels!

Huh? A Fighter you were extracting got
released? Ah well, shit happens. It'll
take a whole 4 hours for the extraction to
complete, but, you know, the higher grade
the Fighter is, the more SPLithium you'll be
able to extract! So don't let the more
precious ones escape...

The trick to winning fights with a player? 
Well, the team with the most HATE will
have a full Rage Gauge at the start of
the raid or defense. The stronger the
opponent you're fighting, the more fight
points you'll get. Good luck man!

Your TDM points just aren't going
up fast enough? Well, you might
just need more of a challenge.
Taking on tougher opponents
seems to increase your points faster,
so go on, be a giant killer.

You sent a Hunter after someone?
Hopefully they'll bring back something
good! You know, if you give them gear,
the durability will go down. It might
even break! The nicer the gear, the
more it'll go down, but that's what it's for!

Heard you got a Spiky Crusher! Rock on!
It's not the fastest, but it's got a
long reach and its explosion AoE attacks
are perfect for when the enemy's
got you surrounded!
Plus, its Rage Move is pretty killer...
Did I mention I'm afraid of needles?

Heard you got an Electric Shock Massager!
Man, that's rad! Anyway, that thing's no
good unless you get up close and personal,
feel me? Whittle 'em down for a bit, wait
for the perfect moment, then jump in and
ZAP! Plus, its Goretastic Attack will blow
your mind. Or the enemy's, actually. LOL!

Nice weapon, right? First, raise the
Mastery Level and get all the ammo
types. You might need a little practice
to get your shots to hit! It's all about
keeping a steady rhythm. If this babe
is too fast for you, press #BTNS_L1 or #BTNS_R1 to slow
down the gun barrel's rotation.

Have you bought a Defense Alarm? It might
just save your waiting room, you know?
But watch out, if a Fighter with an Alarm
attached gets captured then the Alarm stops
working! You'll have to set the Alarm on
another Fighter! Try checking the defense
settings whenever you log in.

So you got your hands on the Vajra of
Light. I love using this weapon, and you
will too! Increasing your Mastery Level for
it will allow you to use the move Spiral
Edge. It'll break an enemy's guard, but
kinda slow to use. At combo level 2 it'll
deal damage no matter what!

You got the Head of Medusa? You can throw
it at enemies from afar and then close the
distance. Just try not to blow yourself up!
Bet you're thinking, pretty shitty for a
Rage Move that uses up 3 gauges, right?
Wrong! When you're surrounded it'll drain
enemies' HP within range instantaneously.

Yo, you got the Mortal Bobslayer? Hit 'em,
shoot 'em, or just chill down a slope on
it! Raise its Mastery Level to get some
more projectiles. 3-Way pumps out damage
at close range, and the Bomb's a surefire
knockdown. And man, that Rage Move! But
check it, you can cancel it with #BTNS_L2 or #BTNS_R2.

Got yourself a Lion Dance Knuckle weapon?
This is a true weapon of intricacy! Capable
of a flurry of hits, mastering these will
allow you to perform even more punches
and also drain enemy HP. But what's most
impressive is the majestic music that plays
when you're attacking. Dance you proud leo!

Oh! Picked up a Stun Gun weapon, have we?
Fire some spicy electrodes into the enemy
then smack 'em up with another weapon while
they're temporarily out of it! Reloading
will reset the electrodes, but you'll still
have to wait for it to recharge, bummer.
Shake off incoming electrodes with Dodge!

A Timber weapon? Yes, good, very good. This
sucker's a primitive beat stick, not saying
it doesn't pack a punch though! Master it
and you'll be able to set it ablaze and lob
it places, too! It can be a bitch to get
the fire lit; I heard LUK may help here...
Me? I just love flinging 'em everywhere!

Yo, Meijin here!

I've got some Meijin Tips with your name
on! Drop by the arcade some time and
lemme impart some of my wisdom, OK?
You won't regret it!

...Whoa! Looks like I've got an intruder to
deal with.

Adios, dude!

By the way, the battle I'm fighting while I
