Yo, Meijin here!
 
Tough to admit, but a mistake has been
discovered among my Meijin Tips in
regard to use of the Drill. A real whopper
of a mistake, most unfortunate
considering my overall reputation.
 
When talking about the drill, I might have
mentioned something about using the
piercing attack to knock people down.
Well, you can't even actually do that, so
I've changed the description blurb a bit.
 
I'm full of feelings of regret about this,
spreading false information, upsetting my
fans and all the other players too.
I need to turn the professionality dial
right up around here, that much is clear.
I won't mess up a single frame going
forward.
 
Hope you'll keep on coming back!
Adios, dude!
 
Meijin

The heart-shaped cap of the
mushroom restores HP
when eaten. Its effects increase
with heat. It is a delicacy.

The "grains of rice" are
actually powerful, swollen
Heartshroom-esque healing
components. Tastes better
than most mushrooms.

Resembling a fist, the tip
contains propulsion parts and 
explodes when thrown. Known
as one of the "3 Exploshrooms." 
Do not eat.

Crystal-like minerals have
formed over time. Tough and
non-poisonous. Not ideal for 
eating, but can harden the user 
temporarily.

Contains magma-like parts in
the cap. Very light and explodes 
at the slightest touch. One of
the "3 Exploshrooms." Do not 
eat.

Has a round, cotton-like cap,
and poisonous spores. Just 
touching it will put you to sleep. 
Do not trust its sweet smell.

Contains -Doomitin poison
that induces vomiting. Can be 
lethal. Releases poison gas as a 
defense. Heat only enhances
the poison.

With a turquoise cap, this
mushroom aids the user's 
concentration. It spread from 
India to the island of South Tokyo. 
Meaty and tasty.

It contains chemicals that
hinder blood flow to the brain, 
causing temporary fatigue
when consumed. Rare. Dry and 
flavorless.

Mysteriously thins the user's
body tissue. It escapes danger
by erasing its own existence. 
Flavorless and odorless.

Its leg-shaped fungi dissolve 
fatigue quickly. Once eaten, 
fatigue will disappear for a short 
time. Surprisingly tasty.

Can instantly analyze the DNA of
anything it touches and create or
transform into a flawless

Has a unique eye-shaped cap

veins. Slows time down. Has an 
irritating smell.

Consists of "electrocells" which 
release a high electric charge
when eaten. Salty and not very 
palatable.

Cap is speckled with white warts. 
Fills user with a strange power 
that repairs their equipment. 
Meaty texture, very tasty.

This grenade-shaped mushroom 
explodes when force is applied. 
One of the "3 Exploshrooms."
It tastes bitter like gunpowder.

Tough and sinewy, this
mushroom increases muscle 
strength for a short time. Often 
used for doping, it is delicious 
when grilled.

Its surface is metallic and inside
is hollow. Stiffens the user's
body tissue. Rarely seen, heat 
enhances its properties.

Poisonous when the black side
is larger, beneficial when the
white side is larger. Tricky to 
judge with the naked eye.

Feeds on dead Frogs and

properties that vaporize when 
force is applied. Not suitable for 
eating.

Feeds on dead Golden Frogs

Feeds on dead Rats and
contains stimulating properties

Sweet-smelling and tasty.

Feeds on dead Golden Rats and 
directly stimulates the brain, 
increasing aggression.

Feeds on dead Scorpions and 
named after its stinger-like bump.
Increases strength, but makes

Feeds on dead Fish. Only the

Feeds on dead Snails. The

Feeds on dead Golden Snails

Feeds on dead Lizards and

the EARTH RAGE tectonic disturbance
occurred around the world,
splitting the Earth into four terrestrial masses.

Domination, war, disaster, and famine
broke out in the four lands,

In the center of the world,
a single tower rose steeply into the sky.

It was a great structure, looking down
upon the Earth from the heavens above.
People believed that it held the key to the future.

It became known as the Tower of Barbs,
a place at which one could become closest to God.

It became known as the Tower of Barbs,
a place at which one could become closest to God.

Life is a cold, cruel,
mysterious thing.

Time goes on and on, without
any guarantee of success or happiness.

With each step forward 
we fall two steps back, or even worse.

Yet, we walk on -- 
forward into the abyss.

This process repeats itself on
and on for all eternity in perpetuity.

Where do we stand now,
and what destiny awaits us?

Unfortunately, we do not have the
freedom to know such things.

Is there a light at the end of
this path which we tread?

You are now approaching
the top of the Tower.

Thank you for participating in
this event to reach

the top of the Tower of Barbs, 
sponsored by the Yotsuyama Group.

There is an important announcement
from the Yotsuyama Group

for any participant who manages
to reach this escalator.
What I am about to speak of is all true.

This Tower was modified 
by the Yotsuyama Group
after it was formed during the Earth Rage.
The president of the Yotsuyama Group

is none other than Uncle Death,
a messenger from the underworld.

with the task of strengthening
the souls of the dead,

and so this tower was designated for use
as a training ground for that purpose.

that exceptionally strong souls
may be delivered to the moon.

That which you see before
you is that moon,

but of course not the moon
as it is normally known.

It is a ball of fire fueled
by these strong souls.
their peak and collide with the Earth,

disintegrating it into cosmic
dust in an instant.
As you may have already assumed,

Death has planned this collision
of the moon and Earth all along.

You were simply coerced into
climbing this Tower

by disguising it in the form of
a game.

I apologize for having to give
you this terrible news,

all in your moment of glory upon
reaching the top of the tower,

but this voice and all things related
to the Yotsuyama Group were

in order to guide you and others
to the top of this tower.

I hope you can accept
your fate and these truths

and allow yourself to be absorbed
into the moon as intended.

You are now approaching
the top of the Tower.

Thank you for your hard work and
support on this long journey.

Let us embark on a journey of discovery
about the many wonders of the Tower of Barbs.

The Tower of Barbs is located on the
tiny 3.7 sq. mi. island of South Tokyo.

Legend has it, that this island
was formed during the

the equivalent of a 30-story building,
with super high ceilings.

Many say that the tower is actually

to climb the tower to obtain those riches.

As such, many brave people often attempt

wonders that it has to offer.

One of the many attractions of

several different types of mushrooms

There are more than 40 different types

Some of the mushrooms spray

and in some cases, immediate death.

Therefore, residents of the Tower
of Barbs all wear masks to protect

themselves from accidental inhalation
of the deadly spores.

They reanimate the corpses of all
who die in their domain, and in turn,

undead killers within the Tower.

Most visitors are shocked to see that

challenges them, and emerges victorious.
For certain, you must stay on your guard.

Many pieces of equipment are featured in the game. 
Let's take a look at a few basic rules.

Equipment includes weapons which may be equipped
on the right, left, or both hands, and 3 types of
armor: head, upper body, and lower body.

Every piece of equipment has 
durability, which decreases
each time it is used. When the
durability reaches 0, the
equipment will break, so be
careful!

There are single-handed weapons, which you can
equip in each hand, and double-handed weapons,
which you can only equip one of. It's your choice
which weapon you become proficient with.

You can store and carry the
various items you find in the
tower in your Death Bag.

Both the left and right arm
have 3 weapon slots. Use the
directional buttons to quickly
switch between weapons
equipped in these slots.

In this game, you can unleash Rage Moves, techniques
which are stronger than regular attacks. If you use
these effectively, you will have an advantage in battle.

Each time you deal damage
to an enemy your rage will
build, this will increase in level
until it reaches the maximum.

Controller
#CL34When the Rage Gauge is full, hold #BTNS_X #CL34as you 
#CL34attack#CL99 to unleash a powerful Rage Move with
your equipped weapon.
 
Keyboard
#CL34When the Rage Gauge is full, hold #KEYS_E #CL34as you 
#CL34attack#CL99 to unleash a powerful Rage Move with
your equipped weapon.

The number of gauges used up by the Rage Move
depends on the weapon you are holding.

You will encounter various types of mushroom in this
game. They have many uses, but here we'll explain
their role as food items.

When you draw close to a
mushroom, you can consume it
quickly by #CL34selecting the "Eat"
#CL34icon#CL99 which will be displayed.

Controller
When you put mushrooms in
your Death Bag, they will be
displayed in the "Flick Box"
at the top right of the screen.
#CL34Press and hold #BTNS_BACK and
#CL34use#BTNS_YY to cycle left or #BTNS_BB 
#CL34to cycle right, then press #BTNS_A#CL99 to select
the mushroom you want to eat.

Use #CL34#KEYS_PRD to cycle left or #CL34#KEYS_CMA to cycle right, then
#CL34press #KEYS_F#CL99 to select the mushroom you want to eat.

Not all mushrooms are
beneficial to the player. Some
mushrooms contain poison that
can result in death, so be
careful.

The hub of your adventure, this is the waiting room of
the station "Bottom of Barbs," the last stop of Line15.
Situated under the Tower of Barbs, this room
contains many interesting features. 
Just what are you waiting for, you ask? Perhaps the
question should be... what is waiting for you?

To exit the game, #CL34return to the Waiting Room
#CL34and select "Quit the Game" from the Options menu. 
#CL34You can also exit from the title screen.
Warning: Closing the game outside of the Waiting
Room will result in your character's untimely
death, so be careful.

The Storage Chest is capable of holding any of the
materials the player carries in their Death Bag,
including equipment, mushrooms, and beasts.

This is the bank that holds the Kill Coins you receive
from treasure chests after defeating enemies. 
 
They will be automatically stored in your bank when
you return to the Waiting Room in the tower.
 
When you make a purchase at a store that accepts
Kill Coins, the amount will be deducted from your bank.
 
In the same way, the value of any items you sell will
be added to your bank, so you don't need to worry
about withdrawing and depositing yourself.

All quest rewards are placed in this box, in addition to
login bonuses and presents from Captain Yotsuyama.
Make sure to collect your prizes from here after you
earn them!

Kommodore Suzuki is the manager of the store.
You can give him the blueprints and materials that
you find in the tower and ask him to develop
equipment.
 
After the equipment has been developed, it can be
mass produced and sold in the store. Finding things
to be sold in the store however is the player's
responsibility.

If you have blueprints obtained
from the Tower in your Death
Bag when you enter Choku-
Funsha, Kommodore Suzuki will
analyze them for you.

You can purchase weapons and armor.
Once you have purchased a piece of equipment, it will
be temporarily out of stock.
You can sell items in your possession.

If you gather materials
specified by a blueprint, you
will be able to request
research and development.
On such occasions, you will
also require SPLithium
obtained from defeating a specific enemy. The
research development will take some time. When the
research is finished, the items will appear in the
shop, and can be bought as many times as you need
them.

Once research has been
conducted on a piece of
equipment, you will be able to
strengthen it. Materials are 
required each time you
strengthen equipment.

Fourth stage +4 equipment
can now be uncapped!
As with regular R&D,
uncapping requires certain
Materials as well as
SPLithium. Once uncapped,
your new item will appear in the store.

Available at Choku-Funsha,
Funshots are stat upgrades
for your gear. There are 6
types: 3 for attack types
(Slash, Piercing, Blunt)
and 3 for armor types
(Head, Body, Leg). Funshots raise Atk and Def stats
for individual equipment.
 
There are three ways to upgrade Funshots:
advance your equipment tier, uncap your equipment,
or R&D new equipment.
 
Your Funshot effects will also apply to the
weapons and armor you pick up.
 
*Some limited-time event weapons and armor may
be excluded.

with your cooking!

The Tower of Barbs features not only escalators,
but elevators also, including the DH Express Royal
Elevator. There is also a system of rare
sub-elevators that run only between certain floors
of the tower.
 
For more information on DH Express please read
Barb's Bible vol.20 "About DH Services"

When you #CL34discover an elevator
#CL34in the tower, turn the power
#CL34switch ON to allow the 
#CL34elevator to stop at that floor#CL99.
Once you have done this you
can just use some Kill Coins
and hop in the elevator anytime you wish to return
to that floor.
 
Using elevators to return to the waiting room and
refresh yourself is probably a good idea if you want
a pleasant climb to the summit.

The Royal Elevator allows DH Express members to
ride for free. Please tell Miss Torai, the elevator
attendant, which floor you wish to go to. Maybe the
social contact will be a bright spot on your lonely
adventure.

The characters the player controls in this game are
called Fighters, and you can possess several at one
time. The place where you store them is called the
Fighter Freezer.

There are 8 Fighter types the
player can control in this game.
Each has its own number of
Skill Decal and Death Bag slots,
and will grow differently as it
gets stronger. The mask 
equipped initially will also vary.

All abilities are balanced. Each attribute can be raised
equally.

Specializes in close-range attacks. HP and STR are
prioritized.
Specializes in defense. HP and VIT are prioritized.
Specializes in attacking. STR and DEX are prioritized.
Specializes at shooting. DEX is prioritized.

Specializes in collecting materials.
Death Bag capacity is high.

Specializes in skill expansion. 
Has many Skill Decal slots.

Specializes in increasing Fortune.
LUK is prioritized to increase.

You can now select a Fighter in 
storage to switch with the
Fighter you are controlling.

"Survival Index" is a number
that displays a Fighter's
strength and abilities.
This number will change based
on a Fighter's ability, level,
Equipment, and Decals etc.

You can send Fighters on
expeditions to attack other
players. Fighters who are on
expeditions are referred to as
Hunters, and can earn Kill Coins,
SPLithium and equipment when
they return to you! 
 
If Hunters are equipped with gear developed in
Chokufunsha, the durability will not decrease as they
fight. However, if they use other equipment, the
durability will go down steadily. The amount varies
depending on the equipment.
 
Watch out for red names!
 
If you see a Fighter with a red name, it's a Hunter that 
someone has sent after you!
Make sure to take revenge against them when you
find them!

You can change a Fighter's title and assign Skill
Decals here. You can also manage your selected
Fighter's Death Bag and storeroom items.

Fighters you no longer need can be disposed of. You
will be able to get back the SPLithium stored in these
Fighters.

If there is space on the rotating
hangers in the freezer, you can
go to the Fighter Depot and
purchase new fighters by
selecting the monitor installed
there.

Salvage Haters in exchange for Kill Coins. 
Carried equipment is also retrieved. 
There is a discount for Express Pass holders.
 
You can also pay in Death Metal to salvage
Haters from the Tower of Barbs floors 21 and above.

Salvage Haters from Tower of Barbs floors 20 and
below for free, but you lose items those Fighters
were carrying.

There are many enemies in this game, but if you
defeat a Hater, you will receive SPLithium, which can
be stored in this coffin. When you return to the
Waiting Room from the tower, it will automatically be
stored in your bank. As with Kill Coins, there is no
need to worry about depositing or withdrawing it
manually.

SPLithium is used for equipment R&D and expanding
the facilities in your base.

This shop opens after you rescue the Mushroom
Magistrate, the owner of the shop. They will deal with
Skill Decals formed from mushroom powder.

Attaching Decals to a Fighter's
body will benefit the player
with various effects. There are
many designs and functions.
Once a Skill decal is attached,
if the Fighter dies or if the
Skiil decal is removed, it will disappear.

You can buy Skill Decals with Kill Coins or Death
Metals.

You can sell Skill Decals in your possession. Since you
can't get rid of them, you may as well sell those you
have no use for.

If you bring the Bronze
Skillshroom, Silver Skillshroom
or Gold Skillshroom the
Magistrate is seeking to the 
store, she will trade them for
Skill Decals.

You can spend Kill Coins to
drink some mushroom stew
which the Mushroom
Magistrate has put her heart
into making. As a bonus, a
Premium Decal is always inside!
These Decals are different to standard ones, they will
not disappear if the Fighter they are attached to is
killed.
 
Please note: Mushroom stew purchased with Death
Metals will contain Death Metal fragments, or Death
Shavings. Mysteriously, these metal components tend
to attract more uncommon Premium Decals!

We've teamed up with the insurance company Direct
Hell to offer a special service to support players. 
It's called DH Service, and you can access and sign
up for it in the options menu. Remember, you'll need
some of the special currency known as Death Metal
to sign up, though.

Visit the DH Store to purchase an Express Pass.
You can also convert Death Metal, buy special
discount packs, and more!

You can exchange Death Metal
for Kill Coins. The exchange
rate is 1 Death Metal to 5000
Kill Coins.

Do you ever find yourself
shouting "I want to climb the
tower faster!" or "I want to
play more efficiently!"?
Well, all that can be yours
with the purchase of an
Express Pass. After you purchase and use an
"Express Pass" the services below will become
available to you for 30 days.
 
1. Once a day you will receive a "Limited Decal" as a
login bonus.
These Skill Decals have a variety of effects
including increasing your HP recovery or your EXP
or Kill Coin gains in the tower.
 
2.You will be able to use the Royal Elevator.
Unlike the normal elevator, which requires Kill Coins
to operate, this extraordinary luxury elevator will
transport you to your chosen floor of the tower free
of charge.
 
3. The number of slots in your Death Bag will
increase.
These extra spaces are called Royal Slots and will
be marked with a crown icon.
If you stop using the Express Pass service, the items
being held in the Royal Slots will be sent to your
rewards box.
 
4. Save on Hater Retrieval costs! Place a request
from the Fighter Freezer and you can retrieve your
own Hater. Normally it's expensive, but this way it's
more affordable!
 
5. Zero damage with Attack Insurance!
We promise to reimburse all Kill Coins and
SPLithium lost even if your Waiting Room is attacked
by another player during the Online Battle Mode
"Tokyo Death Metro."

You can expand the Storage
Room using Death Metal. For
2 Death Metal you can buy
another 10 slots. These slots
will always be usable.

Using Death Metal you can
reduce the time it takes to
perform R&D or upgrades
at Chokufunsha.

A manager will explain this to you at the appropriate
time.

If your Fighter exhausts their HP in this game, they
will die, and be resurrected as an enemy.

When a fighter dies, they will
transform into an enemy,
roaming about on the floor on
which they met their demise.
Such Fighters are called
"Haters." 
 
If you assume control of a new Fighter and defeat the
Hater, they will be retrieved and stored in the Fighter
Freezer. If you let them be and they defeat another
player, the rewards will be sent to your Rewards Box.

All enemies with names
displayed in orange are Haters.
They might be one of your
Haters, or a Hater that was
once a different player.  In
either case, they are far
stronger than most of the other enemies you will face.
Watch out for them.

Controller
If you defeat lots of enemies with a specific
type of weapon, your Mastery Level with
that weapon will go up.
 
The maximum level is 20, and you'll unlock
sub-moves that you can use with
#BTNS_L1 or #BTNS_R1, as well as new attacks
and skill boosts!
 
Keyboard
If you defeat lots of enemies with a specific

that weapon will go up.
 
The maximum level is 20, and you'll unlock
sub-moves that you can use with
#KEYS_U or #KEYS_I, as well as new attacks
and skill boosts!

ABP (Ability Points) will be
awarded to the weapon which
dealt the final damage in
defeating an enemy. Once you
accumulate a set number of
points, your "Mastery Level"
will increase.

"The Mastery Level and ABP points acquired are
shared between fighters. Even if you switch to a
low-level fighter, you will still be able to deal attacks
corresponding to your Mastery Level."
Mastery Lv not Dependent on Fighter

Mushrooms will sprout from
the corpse of any animal that
you kill by stomping, or by
any other method.
The type of mushroom that
grows will depend on the type
of animal.

There is always one stamp station on each level of
the Tower of Barbs.
You can stamp each one once into the Stamp Section
of the Underworld Rolodex. It's possible to climb the
tower without stamping, but you'll receive some
rewards if you do!

Mingo Head is this game's Fighter training machine, a
fancy character who always greets the player when
they return to the Waiting Room. 
He's not all show, however, but a valuable character
who'll  raise a Fighter's level for you.

You will receive EXP for
defeating enemies and eating
mushrooms in the tower. By 
collecting EXP you can raise
your Fighter's level. EXP can
only be used by the Fighter
who acquires it.

Upon returning to the waiting
room, Mingo Head will absorb
all the Kill Coins and
SPLithium you collected. If you
have enough EXP to level up,
you can split the points
between your 6 stats to become stronger.

HP (Hit Points) This will influence your maximum
health.
 
STR (Strength) This will mainly affect your physical
strength for non-ammo weapons.
 
DEX (Dexterity) This will mainly influence your firearm
attacks.
 
VIT (Vitality) This will influence your defensive
capabilities.
 
STM (Stamina) This will affect the maximum level of
your stamina gauge.
 
LUK (Luck) This will influence the amount of Kill Coins
you receive, as well as improving your chance of a
critical hit every time you perform an attack.

If canceled, you can level up at any time by accessing
the machine again.

Once your Fighter has maxed
out all their stats, bring them
to Mingo Head to uncap them.
Unlike a normal level-up,
uncapping requires Bloodnium
and Death 'Roids.

Thank for you playing "LET IT DIE." From today, this
new online battle mode will allow players to
experience the thrill and violence of fighting it out
head-to-head. Access the Metro Front for more
details.

A terminal managed by railway
employee Tetsuo. Your access
point for everything related to
the Tokyo Death Metro.

View which teams are making a splash in the
Underworld based on aggregate data.

Check out the team you belong to
or jump ship to another team.

Enhance the facilities found in the Waiting Room and
deploy Fighters that you own.
 
Defense Settings
Deploy Fighters that you own in order to defend your
Waiting Room.
 
Alarm Purchase
You can purchase a Defense Alarm.
After purchase, go to Defense Settings and
select a Fighter to hold the Alarm.
 
Enhance Equipment
Use SPLithium to enhance the facilities found in
your Waiting Room.
 
Remodel
Customize the floor, pillars, or fountain to suit your
personal tastes.
Pay the fee to complete the work instantly.
All charges are payable in Death Metal only.
 
Defense Simulation
Run a simulated attack on your own Waiting Room
to look for weak points.
Select a destination and attack it.
View reports on defenses, attacks and fights.

Take the train from the Metro Front to go and
attack other players' Waiting Rooms! But be warned,
their Fighters will be waiting for you... Fight your way
through them and invade their Waiting Room!
There, you can destroy your target's Buffalo Bank
and SPLithium Tank to plunder the contents!

There is a time limit on attacks.
You will automatically retreat
once the time limit is reached.

Defeat defending Fighters
during an attack or destroy the
opposing player's Kill Bank or
SPLithium Tank to increase the
rate of destruction caused.

The rewards you obtain differ
depending on how much of the
target's Buffalo Bank and
SPLithium Tank you destroy.
 
Please be aware, if the reward
you obtain exceeds the space available in your
Buffalo Bank or SPLithium Tank, you will not receive
the reward.

Causing at least 50% destruction to the Waiting
Room you are attacking results in a successful
attack, resulting in winning TDM Points and Fight
Points.
You may also acquire mysterious paper bags called
"Lost Bags." They are said to contain rare decals
and other precious items.

TDM points are awarded for defeating Defenders in
raids. The higher the grade of the defeated Fighter,
the more points you get.

Bonus points are awarded for achieving Destruction
of 60% or higher.

Controller
#CL34During an attack, you can
#CL34return to the train doorway and
#CL34press #BTNS_A #CL99to retreat. After
arriving, you can only retreat
after a set amount of time has
passed.

#CL34During an attack, you can
#CL34return to the train doorway and

after a set amount of time has

*Direct Hell Express Members may retreat
at any time.

When you defeat a defending
Fighter, they will sometimes

#CL34Press #BTNS_A when close to

Taking Fighters captured in this way
to your base will allow you to

go into a near-death state.
#CL34Press #KEYS_F when close to

Taking Fighters captured in this way
to your base will allow you to

If your Fighter dies during a
raid, you will still receive all
the Kill Coins and SPLithium
they managed to steal from
defending Fighters prior to
their death. They will also
return to you with all equipment and items intact. 
However, you will lose anything you managed to
steal from your opponent's Buffalo Bank or
SPLithium Tank.

After extracting SPLithium from captured
Fighters in your Restroom, you can also
obtain Lost Bags from them.

SPLithium extraction from
captured fighters takes
4 hours. Fighters always
successfully escape after
extraction, giving you a chance
to get a Lost Bag each time.

If you are attacked and your
Restroom is destroyed, all
captured Fighters will return to
their original players. On the
other hand, attacking another
player's Waiting Room can
destroy their Restroom to free all of the Fighters
held there. When that happens, you can also steal
any stocked SPLithium from the Restroom.

You have to deploy your own Fighters in order to
defend your Waiting Room. These Fighters will be
called Defense Fighters and will fight automatically
if you are attacked.

You can change Defense
Settings through the 
"Waiting Room" option at the
Metro Front. After defending
your Waiting Room, the
Defense Fighters' equipment
durability decreases, apart from equipment created
through R&D.

"Overall Survival Index" is
the power of a Defense
Fighter set to your Defenses.
Can be a useful indicator
when defending.

A special kind of alarm that can
be equipped to deployed
defense fighters. When the
alarm is triggered, a powerful
ally will appear.
 
You can find them in "Waiting Room" > "Purchase
Alarms" from the Metro Front. Note that only
one alarm can be set at a time. After purchasing, you
can equip the alarm to a defense fighter in the
Defense Settings.

Each alarm will summon different allies and lasts a
different amount of time. Once purchased, when the
alarm runs out, it will disappear. Also, purchasing
two or more of the same kind of alarm will stack
their validity periods. If you purchase a different
kind of alarm the currently set alarm will disappear.

When you successfully
defend against attacks from
other players you will obtain
Kill Coins and SPLithium in
accordance with TDM Rank.
You may also sometimes obtain
a mysterious Lost Bag. *See TDM Bible Vol.6 for
details of TDM Rank.

You can use SPLithium to
enhance your Kill Bank and
SPLithium Tank. Doing so will
increase their HP (hit points),
making your Waiting Room
harder to destroy.

So, you know how to attack and defend a base. Now,
let's introduce the 2 systems that will help you rise
to number one. Please enjoy TDM alone or as part of
a team.

"Battle Rush" is the name given to the reward
system that provides rewards based on the
results of your Attacks and Defenses during a
7-day period.

Depending on the TDM Points earned through your
Battle Score, you will be ranked either Bronze,
Silver, Gold, Platinum, or Diamond. Each rank is
also split into the Sub-ranks I, II, and III.
Rewards are decided once "TDM Battle Rush"
has finished. If you do not log in within a week of
"TDM Battle Rush" finishing, you won't be able
to collect your reward.
 
Everybody will start at Bronze III;
so let's aim for Diamond I without too many panic
attacks, OK?

Please note, you will keep your TDM Rank even after
Battle Rush has finished, however, your Sub-rank
will be reset.

Hate is the representation of
the feud that builds up
between teams as they attack
and defend. When a teams
hate gauge reaches maximum,
a 24 hour "Fight" will begin.
 
Please be aware that if you fail even once during
a fight (destroying less than 50% of the
opponent's base), you will not be able to participate
in the fight anymore.
 
You gain Fight Points depending on your success in
raiding or defending. But, it's your whole team's
total Fight Points that determines whether you win
or lose a fight.
  
After a fight has ended, you will be sent a reward
based on your Contribution Points, so try and
participate as much as possible. You will also
receive a small reward if your team loses the fight,
but you wont receive anything if you don't raid at
least once.

There are 6 types of equipment: slashing, blunt,
piercing, fire, lightning and poison.

You can hold up to 2 types of
weapon at the same time. It's
important to pay attention to
the type of armor the enemy is
wearing and manage your
weapons accordingly.

Armor has a defense value that
varies with the type. It's
important to pay attention to
the enemy's weapon and switch
accordingly.

This is a service where Uncle Death will deliver the
player presents on his beloved death-mobile free of
charge. It not JUST a login bonus... it's "Uncle Prime."
 
Upon leaving the Waiting Room after opening a box,
another will be delivered to you. You will be able to
open this next box 20 hours after delivery.
Express or designated day delivery is not available.

Upon leaving the Waiting
Room after opening a box,
another will be delivered
to you. You will be able to
open this next box 20 hours
after delivery.
Express or designated day delivery is not available.

The contents of boxes are
random. You must be excited
to find out what's inside, so
fling open any box you see.

Players who are members of DH Express are fully
supported when using TDM.

When raiding, players have
access to the "BC256" high-
tech train. Immerse yourself in
the clean and pleasant
atmosphere of this delightful
vehicle as you head out to
attack.

Usually a raiding fighter has to
wait for a set time before being
able to retreat, but, DH
Express members can withdraw
any time they like. So, if you
ever think "This opponent is
way too strong!" or "I could take this chance to
capture a fighter!", then the instant retreat service
would be really helpful for you.

We've prepared a fun new challenge for you:
the 4 FORCEMEN! As the name implies, it's a squad
of four Elite Haters, each of them equipped with
ultra-powerful armor!
Test your skills against them if you dare!

The 4 FORCEMEN have 3
difficulty settings: NORMAL,
HARD, and NIGHTMARE.
Take note: their spawn location
varies by difficulty, as do the
rewards!
 
You can battle on each difficulty for free once
a day!

For this battle, there is a time
limit. Fail to defeat the enemy
within the limit and you will be
executed. Talk about a harsh
punishment! Compete at your
own risk!

To challenge the 4 FORCEMEN,
go to the Entry Box and pay
the required number of Kill
Coins. The fee varies
depending on difficulty.
 
Should you die in this battle, Salvage Requests from
the Fighter Freezer in your Waiting Room will be
free of charge, so don't worry too much about dying.
Just give it a try!

We've set up an item transfer service called
Dustin for all your urgent inventory needs!
It's a safe and secure way to send your items
back to the Waiting Room.

There are two types of Dustin:
Dustin 5 (paid version) and
Dustin TD (free version
available only in certain areas).

Access Dustin to transfer
items. Just select the items
you want to transfer and
away they go! Dustin 5 can
only transfer 5 at a time. 
It costs 1 Death Metal for
every 5 transfer slots.

You can find them located near the escalators on
each floor.

Thank you for playing LET IT DIE!
The latest massive update expanded the Tower
with a brand new area, known as Battle to the Top.
It is the perfect test of skill for the chosen few.

Please note: In order to provide
a more thrilling experience for
our guests, the floors ahead
have restrictions in place
limiting the number of items
you can carry.
 
Please access the Dustin TD item transfer service
by the gate and reduce your inventory to 5 items
or less by sending your excess belongings to the
Reward Box in the waiting room. You may use this
service free of charge.

Once you pass through the
gate, you will not be able to
turn back. Only proceed
when you feel you are fully
prepared.

Tryptamine D is a mysterious pickle that enables
you to escape from any part of the Tower.
Access the Tryptamine Server and drink a
concentrated extract of the pickle to return to the
waiting room. This service is free of charge.

In this area, you can use the waiting room's
Choku-Funsha shop and the vending machine Hernia.
You'll definitely want to make use of them.

Please note: At these
Choku-Funsha shops, all you
can do is buy items. You will
be unable to develop blueprints
or sell items.
 
In addition, there may be purchase limits, so plan
your shopping carefully.

In order to streamline your Quests,
we've set up the Superscope 703!
Just take a peek and you'll be able to
remote-access the Death Drive 128-compatible
D-MATE laptop in the HATED ARCADE.
Give it a try!
 
You can also pick up Quests the normal
way, by exiting the game and returning
to the HATED ARCADE directly.

The boy and girl statues either
side of Superscope 703 will
have glowing eyes and wave
their arms excitedly to notify
you when quests have been
added or updated.

Thank you for playing LET IT DIE! With our latest
large-scale update, we have expanded the Tower of
Barbs even further.
We hope this expansion, TENGOKU, will be even
more challenging!

This section of the tower is a
mysterious place that seems
to grow and grow the further
you climb. For that reason, we
cannot provide you with a
detailed floor map.
 
In this area, killing enemies will grant you not
SPLithium but Bloodnium, a strange new source of
energy.
You may also find Death 'Roids, a powerful drug
that will strengthen your Fighter.
 
You'll continue to encounter inventory restrictions,
one-way passages, etc. as you go, so proceed with
caution.

As you explore this new area, your Search
Results will be displayed whenever you return
to the Waiting Room. You will receive bonuses
for the Bloodnium you acquire.
 
*Bloodnium obtained through Splattershrooms will
not count toward bonuses.
 
- Exploration Bonus:
Based on how far you progress through the area.
 
- Kill Bonus:
Based on the number of enemies defeated.
 
- Express Member Bonus:
An exclusive bonus for Express Members.

Special treasure chests known
as Legendary Chests can be
found in certain parts of
TENGOKU. View the Floor Map
on floors 52 or higher to check
the contents of chests located
above. But be warned: once you return to the Waiting
